properties.name: 108 Mile Ranch
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus108 mile ranch, british columbiaA coourse in the middle of a resort community in the middle of nowhere. Fairly open, long and unmemorable.

properties.name: Acqua Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  555 Redwood Highway, Mill Valley, CABoutique hotel right off of highway 101 seems like a contradiction in terms. If I\'m out here why would I want a small, froofy room with no additional amenities anywhere in sight? The boutique feel may be important for others, but if I\'m hearing the whine of the highway anyway, skip the pretense and put me in a Travel Lodge.

properties.name: Adler Thermae
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Adler Thermae Unlike most spas in Italy, the luxurious new Adler Thermae in the heart of Tuscan wine country is worth visiting just for its food—broccoli rabe flan on cannellini bean puree and spicy tomato-based Livorno fish stew—and the panoramic views from the rooftop dining room. The spa, which is in a large villa in Vignoni, makes a point of featuring organic and biodynamic products, such as the highly regarded Corte Pavone wines from nearby Montalcino. DETAILS Bagno Vignoni, San Quirico d\'Orcia; 011-39-0577-889-000. " Food and Wine October 2006

properties.name: Aji
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1601 Pearl St., Boulder, CO

properties.name: Akagera National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Rwanda\'s share of wildlife is thinner than at game parks just across the border in Tanzania, but the savanna of Akagera National Park is home to giraffes, hippos, crocodiles, antelope, and elephants." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Akaroa fish and chips
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus akaroa, new zealandFresh battered cod with perfectly salted chips (L daily)

properties.name: Alan Wong's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1857 S. King St., Honolulu, HI"Well before most people has heard of fusion food, Alan Wong was cooking it....This romantic little restaurant has always reached out to local growers so that every diner can discover the true taste of what Hawaiians call home." properties.name: Alice's Champagne Palace
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  195 E. Pioneer Ave., Homer, AKThe closest thing Homer has to a music venue (hosting Beausoleil when we were in town) also has respectable bar food.

properties.name: Alinea

properties.name: Alligator Pear

Get the No. 1, Prince\'s fave, with roasted turkey, New Mexican green chiles, sharp white cheddar, mayo, and some of that creamy alligator pear, all layered on a roll and grilled" Seattle Weekly best of 2006

properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 517 S. Weller, seattle, WAMy favorite booth in the Uwajamaya Food Court and Colby\'s favorite restaurant period. The Kalua pork is melt in your mouth tender.

properties.name: Altes Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "The Old Museum, one of the first purpose- built museums to house a royal collection, was designed in 1823 by Karl Friedrich Schinkel. The façade\'s peristyle of 18 Ionic columns, inspired by the Stoa of Attalos, in Athens, demonstrates Schinkel\'s interest in ancient architecture and epitomizes Neoclassical style and 19th-century museum design." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Anchorage Grand Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 505 West Second Avenue, Anchorage, AK

properties.name: Andaluca
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 407 Olive Way, Seattle, WALongtime Spanish mainstay serves a great selection of small plates like stuffed dates and spicy calamari followed by an excellent shellfish stew.

properties.name: Andina
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1314 NW Glisan, Portland, OROne of Portland\'s finest restaurants. This Peruvian eatery combines imaginative cuisine (fave bean flan) with a lively ambience complete with South American Music. Five stars

properties.name: Angel Park (Mountain)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 100 south rampart, las vegas, nvLas Vegas gold, expensive course crammed into a sprawling development. Better than some but if you\'re expeting desert golf, think again.

properties.name: Antica Roma
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1308 Pearl Street, Boulder, CO

properties.name: Apollo Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 229 Fourth Ave, Seward, AKPassable Greek and Italian food, friendly service. I had the crab leg special.

properties.name: Apple Tree
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus8804 Occidental Avenue, Yakima, WA 98903Famous for it\'s apple shaped island green, this course was once a beauty winding through the apple orchards until the inevitable development took hold. Now it is surrounded by a planned community making the course seem far more ordinary.

properties.name: Arrows
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Berwick Rd, Ogunquit, ME"The radiant heirloom greens and vegetables spilling from the beds beside this 18th century Maine farmhouse are not for show. The kitchen garden is the soul of Arrows, the source of sensuous dishes that inspire a worldly menu as comfortable with Middle Eastern, Sichuan or Thai accent as with New England preserves." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Asia Nora
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2213 M st., washington, dcSecret service agents combing the room, an exclusive and expensive dining nook. The food is excellent. I had grilled sablefish in a green curry sauce. The service is friendly but deliberate.

properties.name: Asilomar Conference Center
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 800 Asilomar Blvd, Pacific Grove, CAExpansive conference facility in prime spot on the Monterey Peninsula. The rooms, however are plain to the point of seeming cheap. "Find yourself smack in the middle of some of California\'s most pristine coast at this Julia Morgan-designed retreat on swanky Monterey Bay. Accommodations are basic but surrounded by the luxuries of nature — tidepools, coastal wildflowers, and a sandy beach. An extra 0 gets you a cozy fireplace room. 312 rooms from 30; www.visitasilomar.com or 866/654-2878" Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: Avalon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1717 Kelleher Rd. , burlington, wa27 holes in second growth woodland above the Skagit Valley. The North and West courses are the best, with interesting holes and gorgeous scenery. The south course is a little tight.

properties.name: B. Johnstone
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 4 N. Main St., Kent, CTA winsome boutique run by Bartley Inge Johnstone, an effervescent interior designer who handpicks her collection of clothing and new and vintage housewares

properties.name: Babbo
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 100 Waverly Place, New York, NY"Mario Batali\'s empire keeps expanding, but this restaurant is still the one where everyone wants to be. His menu includes pasta with foraged nettles, lamb\'s tongue salad and his father\'s famous salume." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Bacchanalia

properties.name: Bambuza
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 820 Pike Street, Seattle, WAModerately good Vietnamese place. The salads are the best, as they are in many Vietnamese restaurants. Green papaya with chiles and lime juice. It is just a great dish almost anywhere. The main dishes are somewhat mixed. The satays are a good bet.

properties.name: Bandon Dunes
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus bandon, or(5 stars) The original course at the Bandon complex, modeled after Scottish style links. Golf the way it was meant to be even if this track has been outshone a bit by its newer siblings.

properties.name: Banff Springs
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus405 spray ave. banff, alberta, canada(4 stars; Stanley Thompson) Classic course where elk wander freely and the Canadian Rockies tower above every hole.

properties.name: Bar Crudo
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 603 Bush Street, San Francisco, CAUnbelievably crreative combos of raw seafood, fresh vegetables and original oils and infusions. Grab a nook at the bar and get ready for a unique dining experience.

properties.name: Barcelona Pavillion
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The Barcelona chair, an icon of 20th-century design, was born in a sleek, equally iconic masterpiece of Modernism in Montjuïc Park: the German National Pavilion at the 1929 Barcelona International Exhibition. Mies van der Rohe designed both, and the pavilion\'s space—enclosed by walls of glass, travertine, green marble, and golden onyx—embodies his concept of open- plan, while its colors and materials define the period\'s ideal of elegance." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Bartolotta Ristorante Di Mare
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3131 Las Vegas Blvd, Las Vegas, NV

properties.description: Posted by EdbogusPleasant campground along a river near all the conveniences of Skykomish (such as they are.) Good hiking trails within 20 minutes or so. Take a bracing plunge into the river. About 25 sites. Reservations possible.

properties.name: Belgique
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1 Bridge St., Kent, CTLocated in a mustard-yellow Victorian carriage house, this European-style patisserie proffering handmade truffles and brioche is for discriminating chocoholics.

properties.description: Posted by Edboguswest road, belgrade lakes,ME(4 1/2 stars; Clive Clark) Quirky and spectacular. This is a tight, tough track with a couple of over the top holes.

properties.name: Bella Vista Mexican Restaurant

properties.description: Posted by Edbogus5500 140th Ave NE, Bellevue, WA(2 1/2 stars) Old muni that gets heavy play. A number of scenic holes through tall pines, but the pace gets so slow at times that it becomes a distraction.

properties.name: Bello Sguardo
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 410 Amsterdam Ave., New York, NY

properties.name: Benguerra Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Benguerra Lodge, on the island of the same name in the stunning Bazaruto Archipelago, 390 miles from Maputo. Set in a national park, its thatched bungalows are built on stilts, just a coconut\'s throw from the sea. Diversions include world-class diving, ocean fly-fishing, and a boat ride to remote Pansy Island, where pansy shells (similar to sand dollars) lie scattered on the sand like so many fossilized flowers (27-11-452-0641" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Best Western City Center Motor Inn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 507 West Main, Bozeman, MTConvenient location in downtown Bozeman but other than that, cheap and flimsy.

properties.name: Best Western Hotel Don Vasco
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Built to resemble a colonial hacienda, the Don Vasco is loaded with amenities, a pool, game room and even a badminton court. Yet underneath you can\'t escape the fact, it is still a Best Western on the outskirts of town.

properties.name: Big Sky
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus pemberton, bc(4 1/2 stars; Bob Cupp) As spectacular a setting as you\'ll find. This flat, valley bottom course has Mouont Currie towering above. Lots of water, interesting holes. One of the best of the overpriced Whistler courses

properties.name: Blackledge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus180 w street, hebron, ct(3 Stars, Geoffrey Cornish) Interesting if average rural Connecticut Course.

properties.name: Blackwood Beach Cottages
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  21711 Pacific Way, Ocean Park, WA"These barn-red, white-trimmed cottages recall the 1940s — a time when grassy dunes, kite flying, and beach hikes kept visitors busy for days. Outside, the cottages are retro, but inside, the style is quilty and plush, with gas fireplaces and full kitchens. Take a short dune trail to surf, sand, and some of Washington\'s best birding, then at day\'s end, stroll the herb garden, check the pond for wood ducks, and enjoy something from Blackwood\'s wine room while the sun paints the evening sky. 10 units from 15; www.blackwoodbeachcottages.com or 888/376-6356" Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: Block 44
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 4365 North Lincoln Avenue, Chicago, IL"Block 44 (4365 North Lincoln Avenue, 773-868-4404; www.block44chicago.com), for a soothing dinner of contemporary American fare. The place is dark, all deep woods and leathers, and quiet. The entrees are lavish: sockeye salmon atop asparagus in a dill risotto (9) and barbecue pork tenderloin with pomegranate molasses (8)." NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Blue Water Taco
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 515 Queen Anne Ave N, seattle, WAA growing chain that has always served above average Baja style tacos. My new passion is the chop salad, which has all the goodies fast food mexican has to offer compiled in a way that makes you think it is healthy.

properties.name: Blue and John Crow Mountains National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  The backwoods of the cockpit country features rare birds, steep mountains, waterfalls and ganja.

properties.name: Boat Street Cafe & Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  3131 western ave, seattle, waOk it is pretentious, the ambience basement like and I\'m tired of it for no other reason than its proximity to my office. However, the food is superb, no way around it, from the sandwiches, to the baked eggs, the the dinner entrees to the bread pudding for dessert.

properties.name: Bobby Van's Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1201 New York Avenue NW, Washington, DCPower lunch haven near lobby gulch. A healthy crab BLT.

properties.name: Buckley's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 232 First Ave. W, Seattle, WAPub food that features standard burgers and the like. Good spinach and cobb salad.

properties.name: Buffalo Run Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 60084 State Route 20, Marblemount, WACascade Mountain oysters and buffalo burgers. Pleasant outdoor seating in the back.

properties.name: Bulago Island Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Rustic accommodations dot the islands of the Ssese Archipelago. Among the nicest of these is Bulago Island Lodge, where you can while away the days horseback riding, watching otters play on the beach, and fishing for quarry that weighs more than you do (256-77-709-970; islandinthesun.biz; doubles, 98, including meals)." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Bull Hayes Restaurant and Bar
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus akaroa, new zealandTavern like…curried pumpkin soup, green lipped mussels in marinara sauce, vegetarian pizza and sticky date pudding with crème anglaise (L,D daily

properties.name: Bushara Island Camp
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Surrounded by traditional villages near the Rwandan border, Bushara Island Camp has eight simply furnished tents and a two-bedroom cottage, all with decks overlooking Lake Victoria. Don\'t miss the nighttime canoe tour of the island (256-77-686-787; acts.ca/lbdc/bushara; tents, 0; cottage, 6; full board, 5 per person)." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Bwindi Impenatrable National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "one of the wildest places on earth, is in the mountainous, volcanic borderlands near the Congo and Rwanda. Here, about half of the world\'s 650 mountain gorillas roam under the protection of armed rangers. None of Uganda\'s thrills—and there are many—tops hiking the steep, nettled slopes of the Bwindi Impenetrable Forest to spend an hour just feet from adorable juvenile gorillas or a seriously intimidating silverback." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Bwindi Impenetrable National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Bwindi Impenetrable National Park, one of the wildest places on earth, is in the mountainous, volcanic borderlands near the Congo and Rwanda. Here, about half of the world\'s 650 mountain gorillas roam under the protection of armed rangers. None of Uganda\'s thrills—and there are many—tops hiking the steep, nettled slopes of the Bwindi Impenetrable Forest to spend an hour just feet from adorable juvenile gorillas or a seriously intimidating silverback."Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Cafe Campagne
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  1600 Post Alley, Seattle, WAThe bistro cousin of the well-known French restaurant upstairs, the food is simpler but just as sumptious. A recent prix fixe menu included a mushroom and cheese omelette, a stewed rabbit and an apple tart. Very popular.

properties.name: Cafe Croissant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  3002 Spenard Road, Anchorage, AKCozy and very popular sandwich place with unique combos and hearty soup.

properties.name: Cafe Flora
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  2901 E. Madison St, Seattle, WACafe Flora continues its long reign as Seattle\'s best vegetarian restaurant. The quality of its food has not flagged since it opened in 1991. The kitchen keeps putting out imaginative haute cuisine without dead animals, like the Oaxaca tacos (who knew mashed potatoes would taste so good stuffed in a corn tortilla?), sage polenta (grilled cornmeal cakes with roasted vegetables, pomegranate molasses, and fig balsamic reduction), and portabello Wellington (grilled \'shrooms, leeks, and other delightful things enhanced by a Madeira wine sauce and sitting in a puff pastry). Even though the menu sounds hoity-toity, the atmosphere is unpretentious. If you are lucky enough to be seated in the glassed-in patio with the bubbling fountain, all your senses will enjoy the evening.

properties.name: Cafe Juanita
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  9702 N.E. 120th Place, Kirkland, WAGreat food from top to bottom. Set in for a three hour affair with the likes of Grilled Octopus with Fennel, Chickpea and Green Sauce, D\'Anjou Pear with Pinenuts, Parmigiano Reggiano and White Truffle Oil, and especially Rabbit Braised in Arneis with Ligurian Chickpea Crepe, Pancetta and Chanterelle. "This is Northern Italian cooking at its best. Dishes like Arneis braised rabbit wrapped in pancetta and sheeps milk cheese and escarole anolini...fashioned from gorgeous Northwest produce in a wonderfully rustic room." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Calistoga Ranch
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  580 Lommel Road, Calistoga, CA"Calistoga Ranch (580 Lommel Rd.; 800/942-4220; www.calistogaranch.com; doubles from 25) is like summer camp for pampered adults, with copper-trimmed cedar cabins serving as beautiful bunks. No cars are allowed on the 157-acre property, so everyone—including robed couples en route to the Bathhouse spa—is escorted about in golf carts. Morning yoga takes place in the wine cave, and after a soak in the spa’s mineral pool, guests stay warm under handwoven chenille throws in front of outdoor fireplaces. The 90-minute Cabernet Classic—grapeseed scrub and grapeseed-oil massage (10)—makes creative use of the Valley’s most famous crop." Travel & Liesure April 2007

properties.name: Campagne
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 86 Pine Street, Seattle, WASimply one of Seattle\'s best. Period. Exquisite French fare and attentive but restrained service.

properties.name: Candy Cane Inn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1747 South Harbor Blvd., Anaheim, CAA bargain motel right next to Disneyland. Pleasant enough all things considered.

properties.name: Caneel Bay Resort
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  st. thomas, virgin islands"Developed by the Rockefellers…resort provides trail maps and offers yoga, meditation and fitness classes." NYT 2/6/05

properties.name: Canlis
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2576 Aurora Ave N, Seattle, WA, United States"The next generation of the Canlis family is now running this venerable institution and they\'ve added GEN X energy to Seattle\'s most romantic room without losing any of the style and refinement their parents brought to the restaurant" Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Canlis
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2576 Aurora Ave. N, Seattle, WASaveur magazine recently named the Original Canlis Salad one of the 100 best dishes in America. It\'s the mint that really puts it over the edge. The other ingredients are crisp romaine lettuce, equally crisp bacon, sultry Romano cheese, oregano, and a lemony olive oil dressing made with lightly cooked egg. The salad is 10 bucks, which I point out because people tend to think that Canlis is for millionaires. (It is indeed for people with sports coats, but if you haven\'t got one, they\'ll spot you one for the evening.) I\'m not telling you that Canlis is a bargain basement in the sky, but all things considered, some small plates and a couple of cocktails—and an hour\'s worth of \'70s classics from the piano player/singer—in the lounge add up to an excellent deal. Bottom line: Canlis is among the top three splurge-worthy joints in town. You will not get better service anywhere, and the mostly Northwest-sourced food sits exquisitely between inventive and scientific.

properties.name: Canyon Lakes
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus3700 Canyon Lakes Drive, kennewick, WA(3 1/2 stars; John Steidel 1981) A quasi desert course with significant elevation change and a few great holes.

properties.name: Caramba
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusPopular Italian restaurant with wood fired pizza oven. Try the grilled calamari with garlic.

properties.name: Carmelita
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 7314 Greenwood Ave. N., Seattle, WAI guess this restaurant shows why I\'m not a veggie. It gets rave reviews but always leaves me cold. The best thing about the vegan cauliflower soup was the capers sprinkled on top. The pasta was bathed in something that tasted like orange juice,

properties.name: Carmine's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 200 W 44th St, New York, NYLoud and incredibly busy family style Italian restaurant. Order light. You won\'t believe the portions

properties.name: Carnation Golf Course
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1810 West snoqualmie river road ne, carnation, waThoroughly pleasant rural golf course that winds through the exotic stumps of an old forest along the flood plain of the Snoqualmie River. And therein lies the problem. Play this course when it\'s dry otherwise bring you mudders.

properties.name: Casa de las Artesanias
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus    "Casa de las Artesanías, or House of the Handicrafts (52-443-312-1248), is a two-story museum shop in the former Convent of San Francisco where you can see (and buy) pottery, textiles, brass pots, gold and silver jewelry, guitars and other stringed instruments made by Purépecha Indians Open daily; free. " NYT 9/16/06

properties.name: Castello di Amorosa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Fourth-generation winemaker Daryl Sattui spent the past 14 years building Castello di Amorosa (4045 N. St. Helena Hwy.; 707/286-7212), a 121,000-square-foot medieval-style castle, constructed from hand-carved chestnut beams, basalt, sandstone, and 200-year-old brick. He was nothing if not thorough: among the 107 rooms are a church, stables, and a dungeon, complete with torture devices. (The entire project cost 7 million.) Says Sattui, a self-proclaimed "madman" with an affinity for pocket squares, "I just wanted to build out all of my ideas." Thus, 100 of those rooms are of no use to the public. Politicians and San Francisco socialites—George Pataki, Dede Wilsey—have hosted events in the frescoed Great Hall. Beginning this month, visitors can taste Castello wines (Merlot, Pinot Grigio) in the underground cellar and then take a 45-minute castle tour. For a couple of hours, you’ll forget you’re in Napa—and the 21st century." Travel & Liesure April 2007

properties.name: Castello di Spannocchia
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "The Tuscan countryside may be dotted with villas, but the farmhouses and castello apartments at this twelfth-century complex come with several unusual extras: an organic farm specializing in heirloom produce and almost-extinct animal breeds, a wildlife preserve with hiking trails, and an educational center whose curriculum runs from archaeology and architecture to painting, literature, and cooking—the latter taught by a chef born on the property. In 2005, tourism contributed almost 62,500 to the farm and its sustainable forestry project, both of which serve to promote ancient and earth-friendly methods among locals. The nonprofit Spannocchia Foundation (which every guest must join, at a cost of 0 per family) supports an educational program for interns and local kids (39-0577-75211; spannocchia.com; doubles, 02–22; houses, 15–,075 per week)." Conde Nast Sept 2006

properties.name: Casuelitas Island Soul
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 81 Vine St, seattle, waThe atmosphere is neighborly and casual at Island Soul, but you\'re still guaranteed the best cornbread in the city—almost like coconut cake, really—and jerk chicken and plantain tostones that will make you want to move to the Dominican Republic

properties.name: Catedral
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The Catedral, built from 1660 to 1744, towers over the city center. Many ornate details have been added over the centuries, including an 18th-century silver neo-Classical baptismal font and a 20th-century pipe organ" NYT 9/16/06

properties.name: Cayo Espanto
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus San Pedro, Belize"This island resort near the Belize Barrier Reef has five vast oceanfront villas (the smallest measures 1,100 square feet, the largest 2,400); four have their own plunge pools, three have private docks. Chefs prepare gourmet fare, and activities include fly-fishing, scuba diving on the reef, snorkeling in the nearby marine park, bird-watching, and indulging in the many spa treatments." Conde Nast July 2005

properties.name: Cedar Knoll
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus13020 Route 116, hinesburg, VT(3 1/2 stars) Ever have a round of golf from thepast come back to you from the murky depths. This one just did. I had fun, the course was interesting and hilly. That\'s about all I remember.

properties.name: Celtic Swell
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2722 Alki Ave.,Seattle,WAAn Irish Pub on Alki with food befitting the British

properties.name: Center Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  50 Massachusetts Ave. NE, Washington DCIn the middle of union station this circle of tables around an old central bar is a fine place to spend some time. Tasty and mountainous salads.

properties.name: Charlestown Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  3800 california sw, seattle, waOur reliable breakfast joint. Kid friendly complete with a mouse pancake special. Waffle breakfasts and hearty omelettes.

properties.name: Charlie Trotter's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 816 W Armitage Ave, Chicago, IL"The reason you come to this understated and vaguely Viennese room is to revel in a lengthy succession of handcrafted, complex and often enchanting dishes. The food is so eclectic, the chef so curious, that you could easily sit down to eight superior courses from as many different countries." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Chateau Whistler
properties.description: Posted by Edboguswhistler bc(4 1/2 stars; Robert Trent Jones Jr.) Simply a great mountain course witj glacial streams and spectacular scenery.

properties.name: Chautauqua
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus900 Baseline Road, Boulder, COA wonderfully quaint historical park that rents out some of the cottages beneath the Flatirons. Atmospheric and highly reccomended.

properties.name: Chautauqua Dining Hall
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 100 year old dining hall serves adequate food slowly. Great location, though and plenty of time to enjoy it.

properties.name: Chester Grosvenor Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus chester, englandThis handsome 19th century building in Chester\'s historic neighborhood can trace its orgigins to Elizabeth 1.

properties.name: Chez Panisse
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1517 Shattuck Ave, Berkeley, CA"Alice Waters\' restaurant is an institution, the place that changed the way American chefs sourced their food and how the rest of us think about what we\'re eating." Gourmet Oct. 2006

properties.name: Chichen Itza
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Chichen Itza"The tropical lowlands of the Yucatán Peninsula and northern Central America are dotted with Mayan and Toltec ruins. Few are as grand as Chichén Itzá. The site\'s pyramids, ball courts, and palaces, grouped around grand plazas, leave no doubt of the sophisticated civilization that thrived centuries before Columbus arrived." T & L Sept 2006

properties.name: Chow
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 215 Church St, San Francisco, CA"Wildly popular and consciously unpretentious, this penny-pinchers\' magnet serves honest fare -- pizzas from the wood-fired oven, thick burgers of grass-fed beef, spaghetti with meatballs, roast chicken and mashed potatoes, soup-and-sandwich specials -- made with the best local ingredients. The savvy try to leave room for an order of the ginger cake with caramel sauce." Fodor\'s Choice

properties.name: Cilantro Restaurant and Tapa Bar
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3421 M St NW, Washington, DCOK the food was good, especially the spicy, home-made chorizo. But they nickel and dime you (.00 for a bottle of sparkling water) and then make you wait to pay the bill.

properties.name: Circa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2605 California Ave. S.W., Seattle, WashingtonNeighborhood tavern serves solid food, especially the marinated flank steak.

properties.name: City Hall Maxim's Palace
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"For the best dim sum experience in Hong Kong, take a number and wait in line at this immense restaurant, where the patrons are as loud as the red-and-gold décor. Carts are stacked with baskets of har gow (shrimp and bamboo-shoot dumplings) and char siu bao (barbequed pork buns), or buckets of fresh tofu. In between servings, you can admire the harbor view or look for a wedding party: City Hall has a popular marriage registry" New York Times 4/5/07

properties.name: Claremont Resort and Spa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  Massive turn of the century landmark is now a first rate hotel, spa and health club with a spread of tennis courts, pools and workout rooms surrounding "the elegant lady". Rooms are adequate, the service and the food in the restaurants top notch. Great kids pools

properties.name: Cliveden House
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus burnham, england"As surprisingly comfortable as it is overwhelmingly grand...England\'s most majestic country house hotel

properties.name: Cloud City Coffee
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  8801 Roosevelt Way NE, Seattle, WA

properties.name: Coit Tower
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The most distinctive structure on the skyline. Inside the tower, 19 Depression-era murals depict economic and political life in California. The government commissioned the murals, and the 25 artists who painted them were each paid 8 a week. You can ride the elevator to the top of the tower to enjoy the view of the Bay Bridge and the Golden Gate Bridge. The views from the base of the tower are also expansive---and free. " Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Conservatory of Flowers
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  Golden Gate Park"Many first-time visitors gasp in awe when they see this gorgeous, white-framed glass structure, and locals will tell you that its effect isn\'t much dimmed over time. Built in the late 1870s, the oldest building in the park is the last remaining wood-frame Victorian conservatory in the country. It\'s also a copy of the conservatory in the Royal Botanical Gardens in Kew, England" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Coosaw Creek
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus8791, EAST FAIRWAY WOODS DR, north charleston, SC(3 1/2 stars, Arthur Hills) A marshy lowland course that looks like it\'s become mired in a sea of houses since Iplayed it.

properties.name: Costanoa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus2001 Rossi Road, Pescadero, CA"An hour south of San Francisco, a gathering of cheery white tent bungalows dot the rolling bluffs like so many covered wagons crossing the tallgrass prairie. The mood here\'s breezy and wholesome — kids riding bikes, communal cook-it-yourself barbecues, and ocean-watching from Adirondack chairs perched on the bluff. Inside, simplicity reigns, with cute plaid comforters and comfy metal camp beds. A bonus for garden lovers: The resort\'s idea-filled landscaping features whimsical driftwood sculptures and native plants. 131 units from 15; www.costanoa.com or 650/879-1100" Sunset September 2006

properties.name: Costas Opa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3400 Fremont Ave., Seattle, WA

properties.name: Cousine Island
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Seychelles"Home to hawksbill turtles, magpie robins, and Seychelles brush warblers, the entire five-acre island is a private nature reserve. Guests stay in four French colonial-style villas, each with sea views and spacious bedrooms. Meals, prepared by the chef, are served either in the main pavilion or en suite. For fun, there\'s swimming, snorkeling, and diving." Conde Nast July 2005

properties.name: Crave
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1621 12th Ave, Seattle"Crave seems like a 1950s luncheonette because it\'s small, street-facing, and everyone seems to know one another—and also because of the counters, which are underneath two perpendicular open windows through which you can watch the fry cooks. But instead of gristly, greasy burgers or cheap cheese melted between slices of white bread, those cooks are preparing crab melts made with fontina cheese and a tangy, zesty remoulade, and their grilled cheeses include New York\'s best sharp cheddar, crisp apple slices, and maple-dijon mustard on sourdough. At dinnertime, the pork chop comes with braised greens in a port glaze, and the closest thing to mac and cheese is goat cheese gnocchi. (If you\'d rather, there\'s duck confit with savory bread pudding.) The real kicker is that chef-owner Robin Leventhal serves only organic, free-range, grain-fed meats, and the components of her dishes are either made in-house or procured from regional artisans. When you think about it, that\'s pretty old-fashioned, too" Seattle Weekly

properties.name: Crow
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 823 Fifth Ave. N, Seattle"Eating at the bar is always a great idea, especially when you\'re at Crow. Now that it\'s settled into the neighborhood and the crushing throngs of diners have streamlined themselves into a more navigable steady flow, it isn\'t necessarily a necessity, but it\'s still a fine idea. You can choose between the booze bar in the front and the kitchen bar in the back; either way, you get the sense that you\'re on the front lines of Northwest cuisine and cocktails. My only beef: Crow needs a Web site. Seriously, the menu changes often, and I need to be able to log on and, at the very least, pretend that I\'m watching the cooks prepare the season\'s freshest seafood and produce. " Seattle Weekly

properties.name: Crow's Nest
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Breakfast and lunch spot with a deck overlooking the Essex Marina. Friendly with fairly standard fare.

properties.name: Crush
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2319 E. Madison , seattle, wa"Because this restaurant is in a quaint house, you might expect needlepoint pillows, loads of knickknacks (an animal salt-and-pepper-shaker collection, perhaps), and a cutesy "kountry kitchen" type of feel. We thank our lucky stars that supersleek Crush offers exactly the opposite vibe. Its mod white-on-white anti-color scheme and matte Verner Panton "S" chairs make you think you\'re in L.A. From the kitchen, chef Jason Wilson, an alum of Aqua in San Francisco, serves up fresh, inventive dishes such as stinging nettle and Penn Cove mussel stew with chorizo and saffron. The menu changes frequently, so you\'ll want to come quarterly at least. Oh, and don\'t wear a turtleneck/cardigan combo here—this place has sex appeal" Seattle Weekly

properties.name: Cucina
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 510 San Anselmo Ave., San Anslemo, CATop notch Italian restaurant in Marin County. Perhaps a dozen tables in a bustling atmosphere. The food is unique and falvorful. Carpaccio of zucchini with almonds and peccorino, a spicy stew of fagioli and sausage, and vanilla bean gelato with espresso poured on top. Recommended.

properties.name: Cyrus
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 29 North Street, Healdsburg, CA"Keane pairs lychee glace with foie gras, sets confit duck on tamarind flavored daikon and marinates his lobster with Thai herbs." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Da Caino
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Da Caino Having a world-famous chef as a mother might intimidate some cooks, but Andrea Menichetti, 28, son of Italy\'s revered Michelin two-starred Valeria Piccini, has perfected his own innovative style. The family restaurant, Da Caino, in Montemerano, features several of Menichetti\'s recipes: ravioli filled with extra-virgin olive oil, served with raw tomato coulis and anchovy colatura (the sought-after drippings from salted anchovies caught on Campania\'s Amalfi Coast) and pasta with a sauce of bottarga (cured fish roe), herring, celery and ricotta. DETAILS 4 via della Chiesa, Montemerano; 011-39-0564-602-817." Food and Wine October 2006

properties.name: Da Marco
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1520 Westheimer Road, Houston, TX

properties.name: Dandelion
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 5809 24th Ave. N.W, Seattle, WA"I don\'t want to put too much stock in the fact that Dandelion is a female-run operation—no, wait, I do. The vibe at Dandelion is inclusive and familial. You\'re allowed to ask questions—dumb ones, smart ones, challenging ones. You\'re allowed to watch. You\'re allowed to hover around the kitchen and take notes (just don\'t get in the way while dinner is moving and shaking). You\'re going to be remembered when you come back, and you\'re going to be rewarded if you make Dandelion a habit—and I wouldn\'t be surprised if that "reward" involved a quick turn at the grill. (Confidential to the Health Department: I\'m just kidding!) Owner Carol Nockold, chef Zephyr Paquette, and the rest of the crew have created an energy that feels co-op-ish, but not in a weird, creepy way. Cementing that mood is, of course, the food. Sourced rigorously from local, mostly organic purveyors and then prepared with extremely high regard for what the ingredients naturally taste like, their signature rosemary chicken dish and the seasonal menu items might make a person actually want to move to Monroe and live on a communal farm. " Seattle Weekly

properties.name: Daniel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 60 E 65th St, New York, NY"This is food as celebration....no American chef is as determined to be up on every new influence." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: David Livingstone Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "History buffs interested in David Livingstone\'s missionary journey should visit the village of Chitambo, near Kasanka National Park, where he died and where his heart is buried beneath a tree."

properties.name: Desert Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusorondo, wa(4 1/2 stars) This is a story of wasted potential. Not suprising it is on the auctionblock. a 00 course with no marshalls leads to 6 hour rounds. But the layout is unique and stunning desert golf with wind almost always a factor

properties.name: Dinette
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1514 E. Olive Way, Seattle, WA"Dinette almost makes me want to be single again, and to live on Capitol Hill again, because it\'s just such a perfect place to fall in like and then in love. The room itself is romantic; the gold leafing sends the candlelight bouncing in every direction, and the soft blue-green walls and rough hardwood floors remind you that the perfect person is both sensitive and resilient. On select Thursdays, when Casey McGill and the Blue Four Trio play \'30s-era swing and jazz, Dinette takes on an energy that I\'ve never felt before, probably because I was born 40 years too late. And the food: Seasonally appropriate pot pies, made with decadent pastry shells, are common—but totally uncommon. Pastas, too, often include a twist (recently, lentils) that render them wonderfully anomalous. Another plus, lead server Talon won\'t make you, or your guests, feel like a dork if you need help selecting a bottle of wine. As perfect as it is for romance, Dinette is just as great for friends; call ahead and make reservations for your best friend\'s birthday."

properties.name: Dingle Gold Links
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusdingle, ireland(Ed Hackett, Christy O\'Connor 1924) My introduction to Irish golf. As poorly as I played here, I was hooked. Rough and challenging. It gets better than this but no more authentic.

properties.name: Dolan's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2319 Arapahoe Avenue,Boulder, COWarm, homey restaurant with fairly standard fare. Ruby trout was outstanding. Desserts average at best.

properties.name: Dooks Golf Links
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus dooks, irelandGreat old course built in the late 19th century. Short and full of wonderful quirks.

properties.name: Double Bluff Beach
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   double bluff road, langley, WAAn off leash beach beneath a long cliff, wondrous pools and sandbars at low tide and views back to Seattle, Mt. Rainier and the Olympics

properties.name: Druids Glen
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus29925 207th Ave. SE, covington, wa(4 stars) One of my favorite Puget Sound area courses. 4 of the best par 3\'s anywhere, all very different. Not a bad hole out there. A little wet and ragged at times.

properties.name: Dulce's Latin Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1430 34th Ave, seattle, wa"Celebrating its 13th year as the queen of Madrona\'s little restaurant strip, Dulce\'s hasn\'t fiddled with its formula for success: fine, fragrant Latin- and Mexican-inspired dishes from Julie Guerrero\'s kitchen and amazingly varied wines from Carlos Kainz\'s enormous, Canlis-challenging cellar. This is the kind of place with a barely varying menu, so be sure to get the advice of your server (or the chef) about what\'s at its very best right now; you may get your main dish customized to the season. And don\'t be daunted by the sheer size of the wine list. Just tell Carlos how much you want to spend on a bottle that goes with your order, and he will astonish you."

properties.name: Dunes West
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus3535 Wando Plantation Way, Mt. Pleasant, SC(3 1/2 stars, Arthur Hills)

properties.name: E Lucevan le Stelle Wine Bar
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 5 Piazza San Francesco, Montepulciano, Italy"E Lucevan le Stelle Montepulciano is one of Tuscany\'s most dramatic hill towns; its Piazza San Francesco, where this hip wine bar is located, has some of the best views. Cinzia Caporali, whose family runs the successful local winery Valdipiatta, and her husband, Luca De Nicolò, restored an abandoned building to create this stylish enoteca with a long bar, sofas and an outdoor terrace. It\'s an especially fun place to stop for an aperitivo and a snack from the vast spread of artisanal prosciutto, salami and mortadella, as well as local cheeses and house-marinated peppers and eggplant. The wines, from all over Italy, are selected with the help of Caporali\'s winemaker sister, Miriam. DETAILS 5 Piazza San Francesco, Montepulciano; 011-39-0578-758-725. " Food and Wine October 2006

properties.name: Eagle Point
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus100 Eagle point Drive, Eagle Point, OR(4 1/2 stars, Robert Trent Jones Jr.)

properties.name: Eaglemont
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus4127 Eaglemont Drive Mount Vernon, WA 98273(4 stars, John Steidel 1994) Quirky, tight mountain style course that can drive you loco if you\'re not hitting it straight (or even if you are)

properties.name: Earth and Ocean
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1112 Fourth Ave, seattle,wa"Hotel restaurants rarely manifest distinct personalities, so a hotel restaurant that consistently takes an individual route to tickling the curiosity and pleasing the palates of its patrons deserves special credit. Don\'t let the restaurant\'s name lead you to expect surf \'n\' turf. Salads are a solid standout, and chef Maria Hines plays with the seafood-earthfood dichotomy like a virtuoso, pushing the envelope of the expected while providing knockout satisfaction without fancying up the food. (Hence, her recent invitation to cook at the James Beard House.) The showbiz department at Earth & Ocean is reserved for dessert, with chef Sue McCown whipping up eye-dazzling constructions with comic names that are downright fun to eat"

properties.name: Earthen Oven
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 53 West 72nd, New York, NY

properties.name: Eastmoreland
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus2425 SE Bybee, Portland, OR(3 1/2 stars) Vnerable old muni in SE Portland has the feel of a classic golf course without the price.

properties.name: Eat's Market Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  2600 S.W. Barton St, seattle, waProof that Italian grandmas aren\'t the only grandmas who make great meat sauce: Bubbie\'s Bolognese at this West Seattle nook owned by Evan Handler and Toby Matasar. Over plump shell pasta, Bubbie\'s sauce is hearty, chunky, and just ever so slightly restrained (you\'ll probably salt it a little). Proof, on the other hand, that East Coast kosher butchers do make the best corned beef: the Market Reuben. The butcher in question is Handler, Bubbie is his grandmother, Matasar is responsible for the incredible desserts and baked goods. Some people are put off by the cafe\'s atmosphere (or lack, they say, thereof). If you find the space hinders your ability to enjoy the chicken soup with matzo balls or the homemade and highly addictive ice-cream sandwiches, call ahead and arrange for takeout; the staff does a great job of making it neat and easy for you to do so.

properties.name: Echo Falls
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusecho clake road, snohomish, wa(2 1/2 stars, Jack Frei 1992) Long the standard for overpriced golf in the Puget Sound area, this course, running through old welands beneath a power line right of way, has just those intangibles that make it an unstasfying place to play.

properties.name: Ecolodge Rendezvous
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus a new American Indian style sweat lodge scented with thyme

properties.name: El Cid
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusmazatlan, mexico(3 stars, Lee Trevino, Robert Trent Jones) 27 holes in the heart of Mazatlan\'s tourist zone offers a glimpse of tropical golf in and around the sprawl of the Golden Zone

properties.name: El Galleon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 411 Crescent Ave. Avalon, CAFriendly and busy restaurant along the harbor front with tender ribs and grilled seafood. Watch out for periodic Kareoke sessions

properties.name: El Nido Resort on Lagin Island
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Sister properties on Miniloc and Lagen islands, these two resorts have taken a leading role in protecting the area\'s greatest assets—its coral reef and marine and forest habitats—by helping to secure governmental protection, collaborating on scientific studies, and planning low-impact development and activities. Every staff member, from gardener to dive guide, has taken classes in ecology, geology, and history. Miniloc, which is in a cove bordered by limestone cliffs, attracts families with kayaking in two lagoons and snorkeling among manta rays, clown fish, and dugongs along natural and ceramic reefs (the latter rehabilitate coral damaged by dynamite fishing). Jungle-fringed Lagen has a more serene, laid-back feel and a spa. Both resorts offer mangrove tours, hiking, and private-island picnics (63-2-894-5644; elnidoresorts.com; doubles, 24–85, all-inclusive)." Conde Nast Sept 2006

properties.name: El Pescador
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 4267 Homer Spit Road, Homer, AKOk you don\'t go to Alaska for Mexican food, but this place still disappointed. The Halibut tacos were pure mush, perhaps the only place in Homer that can\'t cook the fish that draws thousands to the town.

properties.name: El Quetzal
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3209 Beacon Ave. S., seattle, wa"First this Beacon Hill storefront housed a cheap Japanese spot, and then a cheap Vietnamese joint, and now it\'s a cheap Mexican restaurant. But El Quetzal\'s menu is not your typical cheap Mexicali mix of beans, rice, cheese, lettuce, and tomatoes. Yes, you can get a .50 taco with a double flour tortilla, but you can also order an enormous, overstuffed sandwich filled with flank steak, Mexican sausage, or scrambled eggs; or a Gigante Huarache—a sort of Mexican pizza, with your choice of meat or egg or cactus toppings, artfully arranged on a sandal-shaped corn-dough crust. The proprietors say the style of cooking is straight from the streets of Mexico City, but whatever its origin, it\'s all delicious. The salsa is muy picante, service is equally warm, and need we mention . . . ? The prices on the menu top out at 0" Seattle Weekly

properties.name: El Rincon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Southwest 112th Street and 16th Avenue Southwest, seattle, waIn every cuisine, there are certain benchmarks. My idea of the perfect quick-serve Mexican restaurant must have (1) sublime carnitas, (2) crispy and substantial sopes (superthick tortillas), (3) menudo (kinda like pozole, but with feet! and tripe!), and (4) homemade flan. All this just puts them on my radar. El Rincon may be a converted school bus with only 12 chairs, but it\'s a giant of a restaurant. The slow-cooked pork tacos get a last-minute flat grill treatment to add texture to their cumin-spiced goodness. Toasted enriched white bread buns filled with crema, avocado, jalapeño, and your favorite meat make for a mean and filling torta. And the freakishly moist pollo asado is an entrée I would pay 2 to eat. Alas, it only costs a Lincoln. Everything is muy auténtico, and ending with the flan brings you close to renouncing citizenship.

properties.name: Elk Run
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus22500 S.E. 275th Place, Maple Valley, Washington(2 1/2 stars) 18 holes of golf on 15 holes worth of land.

properties.name: Ellesmere Island
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  ellemere island, canada"Ellesmere is a vast desert island-the 10h largestin the world,not a tropical paradise but an icy wilderness at the top of the world, aplace of undulating ice fields, rugged gray black mountains and boulder strewn glaciers." 1001 natural wonders

properties.name: Emerson Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 207 W. Olive, Bozeman, MTThe upscale tenant in an old school building turned non-profit haven The Italian fare is above average. In summer, tables on the lawn outside are informal and irresistable.

properties.name: Enoteca Italiana
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Enoteca Italiana Siena\'s Enoteca Italiana, inside a Medici fortress, has always been one of the country\'s most exciting wine emporiums, with a collection of over 1,300 great Italian wines. Until recently, the place offered only cheeses and salumi. But now there\'s an inexpensive buffet lunch provided by a rotating list of local chefs. The menu varies, but there\'s always a hot primo, such as white bean soup or baked pasta, followed by a secondo, like beef braised in Tuscan red wine; desserts might include a fresh ricotta and fig torte. DETAILS Fortezza Medicea, Siena; 011-39-0577-288-497." Food and Wine October 2006

properties.name: Enrico's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 504 Broadway, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Estrella Del Mar
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusmazatlan, mexico(4 stars, Robert Tren Jones, Jr. 1996) Lovely tropical course but who knows whatit looks like now, since the community planned to surround it is probably a harsh reality today.

properties.name: Etosha National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Etosha National Park\'s scruffy savanna lacks knockout scenery, but within minutes of driving into the park (visits are self-guided), you have a good chance of spotting nearly all of Africa\'s iconic big game " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Eva Restaurant and Bar
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2227 N. 56th St, seattle, waLife is indeed grape at Eva, a Northwesty neighborhood eatery with an internationally influenced menu. Dried grapevines, enlivened with strings of white lights, snake around the cozy dining area, and a grapevine logo decorates the menu. These cues get you thinking that a selection from the well-edited wine list would really hit the spot. Order up a glass of grenache and then something from the "Firsts" menu—we highly suggest the Cabrales flan, served with pear relish and a walnut crisp, and the sweet potato and ginger bisque with peanut sambal. Many rave about Eva\'s rabbit dishes; why not see if the menu\'s roasted rabbit loin entrée with chorizo bread pudding and sherry jus makes you hoppy? In the date-friendly dining room, tables are well monitored (you\'ll never have to ask for more water), and the staff is warm and patient (after all, they get asked about Aunt Voula\'s taramasalata, a Greek dip made with carp roe, olive oil, and bread, on a nightly basis). If you can\'t score one of the few tables there, head to the adjacent bar area, where a superb bar menu—with upscale bites like lamb burgers—awaits

properties.name: Fairway Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "In Kampala, golfers will enjoy the serene Fairway Hotel, just outside town (256-41-259-571;)"Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Fallingwater
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"In 1991, the American Institute of Architects voted this 1939 house "the best all-time work of American architecture." Frank Lloyd Wright built it atop a rocky outcropping and extended the floors to reflect the ledges around it, redefining how architecture could be integrated with nature. The showstopper: a terrace daringly cantilevered over a rushing waterfall." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Farallon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 450 Post St., san francisco caUnusual decor aside, this is a top-notch seafood restaurant. Try the prix fixe menu for 5 before 6:30. "Sculpted jellyfish lamps, kelp-covered columns, and sea-urchin chandeliers give this swanky Pat Kuleto-designed restaurant a decidedly quirky look. But there\'s nothing quirky about chef "Mark Franz\'s impeccable seafood, which reels in serious diners from coast to coast. The menu changes daily, but steamed Prince Edward Island mussels with saffron broth, prosciutto-wrapped striped bass with fingerling potatoes, sage-roasted golden trout, and skate wing with trumpet mushrooms circulate in and out regularly. A three-course prix-fixe lunch menu lets you taste Franz\'s celebrated fare for a reasonable price. A menu of small bites is served from 2:30 to 5." Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Felix
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"This Philippe Starck-designed aerie atop the Peninsula Hotel is justifiably popular with tourists, with its Starck-ly white décor and washrooms with spectacular views (especially when facing the urinals)." NYT 4/6/07

properties.name: Ferry Building
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Renovated in 2003, the Ferry Building is the jewel of the Embarcadero. The beacon of the port area, erected in 1896, has a 230-foot clock tower modeled after the campanile of the cathedral in Seville, Spain. On the morning of April 18, 1906, the four great clock faces on the tower, powered by the swinging of a 14-foot pendulum, stopped at 5:17 -- the moment the great earthquake struck -- and stayed still for 12 months. Today San Franciscans flock to the street-level gourmet Market Hall, stocking up on supplies from local favorites such as Acme Bread, Scharffen Ber Chocolate, and Cowgirl Creamery" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Fino
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 624 Post Street, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Fishing at Bird Creek
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: Fishing the Anchor River
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Another classic river on the Kenai. We fished just back from the beach and saw plenty of silvers running on the tide (only snagged a pink)

properties.name: Flying Fish
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2234 First Ave, Seattle, WAThere was a minute there—when was it, 2002?—when it felt like Flying Fish had fallen out of favor. Folks I knew dismissed it as a tourist spot, and acted as though they\'d become—gasp—Eastsiders just walking past. It seems like that nonsense is, thankfully, over, and the dining crowds are once again recognizing that Chris Keff is tireless in her pursuit of fresh, eco-friendly, incredibly delicious fish and produce. While she was one of the first chefs in town to go totally organic and among the first to go (almost) totally local, Keff and her kitchen can\'t be praised without calling out the exotic Asian ingredients she scores (I\'m still not over the satsuma potatoes I raved about last year), nor the preparations she borrows. If you go with a group, get the whole fried rockfish from the "platters" menu. Your rockfish will indeed be fried and whole, and you\'ll receive rice papers and, get this, pineapple-anchovy dipping sauce to enjoy it with. It\'s interactive eating, and it\'s fantastic

properties.name: Fonda el Refugio
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Landmark restaurant in the Zona Rosa hasn\'t missed a beat for 40 years. Great traditional Mexican food...including a chicken chipotle soup and albondigas with a spicy chile sauce.

properties.name: Fore Street
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 288 Fore Street Portland ME

properties.name: Fork
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 806 E. Roy St., seattle, waThis new New American neighborhood restaurant is a great home for your favorite dish, because depending on what becomes available, menu items change ever so slightly from one night to the next—not a lot, but just enough to keep you really interested. For instance, the "faux fish and chips" might consist of halibut and fingerlings on one visit, seared striped bass and nouveau home fries made with duck fat on the next. It\'s fun—and at Fork, pretty delicious—to be kept guessing. To that end, and to take advantage of seasonal specialties and nifty food science, Scott Simpson\'s menu changes almost completely every so often as well. Recently added to the appetizer menu: General Tso\'s sweetbreads (sweet and spicy glazed veal organs), an example of Simpson\'s signature blend of levity and luxury

properties.name: Forsyth Island
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  new zealandA 2,100-acre property in Marlborough Sound, Forsyth Island has just one three-bedroom lodge, and nearly every window affords spectacular views of neighboring islands. Visitors can watch for whales and dolphins, hike along 22 miles of coastal trails, and swim, kayak, and surf. For an additional 0 per person a day, staff will prepare all meals; otherwise, the lodge kitchen is more than adequately equipped.

properties.name: Four Seasons Hotel Mexico DF
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Simply one of the best hotels I\'ve ever stayed in. We got special deals for under 00 a night, expensive for Mexico but worth it here. The most helpful concierge desk I\'ve ever encountered as well as a breakfast buffet (included in some packages) that features everything from homemade granola to a custom heuvos bar.

properties.name: Fox Hopyard
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1 Hopyard Road, East Haddam, Ct(4 1/2 stars. Roger Rulewich) Wonderful course winding through the Connecticut woods.

properties.name: Fox Meadow
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus167 Kinlock Road, Stratford, PE(3 1/2 stars) New coourse just outside Chorlottetown.

properties.name: Franklin Canyon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusfranklin canyon golf course(3 stars, Robert Muir Graves, 1968) Interesting but overplayed muni in the East Bay.

properties.name: Frasca
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1738 Pearl Street, Boulder, CO, 80302

properties.name: Ft. Lewis
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus ft. lewis, wa(3 1/2 stars) Some absolutely classic old (and new) holes and some mediocre ones in this military course now open to the public

properties.name: Furry Creek
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusfurry creek, bc(3 stars, Robert Muir Graves 1993) Golf doesn\'t get any quirkier than this course loaded with blind anf unfair shots. The par 3 14th along Howe Sound is a classic hole, though, oft photogrpahed

properties.name: George Wright
properties.description: Posted by Edboguspoplar st., boston, ma(4 stars, Donald Ross) An urban gem, rough around the edges due to heavy play.

properties.name: Giovanni's Caffe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2420 Shattuck Ave., Berkeley, CADark, old style Italian joint with home made focaccia and spicy sausage and peppers.

properties.name: Glendoveer
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus14015 NE Glisan St, portland, or(2 1/2 stars) The East Course is both the more difficult and more traveled of the two Glendoveer courses. It travels over many good-sized hills, producing a variety of uphill and downhill lies to test your concentration. Big fir trees line the East course, which is also well bunkered. The West Course enjoys a split personality; the front side is flat, with nary a dogleg, though five through nine are lined with trees. The back nine is just the opposite, hilly and covered with oak, maple and fir trees. Though the only water to be found on either course is on the par-3 third of the East Course, Glendoveer provides a solid collage of golf holes.

properties.name: Glenmore Plaza Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 120 Sumner Ave., Avalon, CARemodeled old hotel has small tidy rooms, friendly atmosphere and a great location.

properties.name: Globe Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 270 Pacific Ave., San Francisco, CAFamous for it\'s late night fare, this Bistro also serves ample lunches. The salade nicoise was heaped with seared ahi which made up for a bit of timidity on the dressing.

properties.name: Gold Mountain
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus7263 W. Belfair Valley Road , bremerton, wa(4 1/2 stars, John Harbottle 1996) Simply one of the best munis anywhere. One course that is among the best in the state and a second older course that is no slouch either.

properties.name: Golden Haven Hot Springs
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1713 Lake St., Calistoga,CA"The classic Calistoga mud-bath experience—sinking into an aromatic mass of muck heated to 105 degrees—is not for the prim. This town has more kitschy mud emporiums than one would care to count, let alone visit. But among the long-standing lot, the private Golden Haven Hot Springs (1713 Lake St.; 707/942-8000; treatments from 9) is one of the most professional and up-to-date"T&L 4/07

properties.name: Gramercy Tavern
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 42 E. 20th Street New York, NY

properties.name: Grand Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  501 Geary St, San Francisco, CAMassive Theater District restaurant with an adequate bar menu. The food is average in every way.

properties.name: Granite Pointe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus nelson, bc(3 stars) Hilly and scenic

properties.name: Great River
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus130 coram lane, milford, ct(5 stars, Tom Fazio) A great, challenging upscale public course along the Housatonic River.

properties.name: Grootbos Private Nature Reserve
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "No other tourism operation combines environmental and humanitarian aid as deftly as Grootbos. The owners of this 3,900-acre protected area, a hundred miles from Cape Town, run its two lodges and a neighboring non-profit Green Futures Horticulture and Life Skills College. All 23 graduates are now employed, and the college will soon be supported entirely by students\' plant sales and landscaping projects. Part of the Cape Floral Kingdom, Grootbos includes such vividly named species as fire lilies and paintbrush flowers. Southern right whales breed just off the coast from June through December, and guests can walk or ride horses in the reserve year-round (27-28-384-8000; grootbos.co.za; doubles, 85, including meals)" Conde Nast Sept 2006

properties.name: Grouse Mountain Skyride
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus A spendy trip to the top of a ski mountain 20 minutes from downtown Vancouver. Restaurant, a pair of penned grizzly bears, parasailing, an assortment of hikes and a killer view await all who pony up.

properties.name: Growbush Cove
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusprince edward island(4 1/2 stars) A fantastic and challengin course on PEI\'s north shore. One of the best in Canda features a combination of wetlands and , beach dunes and forest.

properties.name: Guggenheim Museum Bilbao
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Soon after it opened in 1997, critics hailed the dynamic, swirling titanium mass as one of the 20th century\'s great buildings. As the catalyst for the regeneration of this Basque city, the structure claims an intimate yet fluid connection with its setting: it hugs the curves of the Nervión River, its silvery "tail" emerging beneath a bridge like that of a giant metal fish." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Hagia Sophia
properties.description: Posted by ChinsisheistanbulIsodorus & Anthemios 532 AD Istanbul, Turkey

properties.name: Hagia Sophia
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusistanbul"The dome atop Constantinople\'s Church of Divine Wisdom, erected in 532 A.D., was the largest in the world until St. Peter\'s was completed 1,000 years later. In 1453, the conquering Ottomans turned the Byzantine church into a mosque, adding minarets and plastering over its elaborate mosaics. This confluence of cultures is now a museum—with its mosaics resplendently restored" T & L Sept 2006

properties.name: Half Moon Bay (Ocean)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus2 Miramontes point road, half moon bay, Ca(4 stars, Arthur Hills 1997) A poor man\'s Pebble Beach with an finish along the ocean.

properties.name: Halibut Campground
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusStunning location for this simple state campground, set among fields of fireweed just back from the beach with views across Cook Inlet

properties.name: Hana Zen
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 115 Cyril Magnin St, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Harbour Pointe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus11817 harbour pointe blvs, mukilteo, wa(4 stars, Arthur Hills 1991) Still a fun, challenging course even though it is now surrounded by a sea of houses. Flat watery front nine and hilly and formerly woodsy back.

properties.name: Herbsaint
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 701 St. Charles Avenue, New Orleans, LA"Here is where dark, rouxy gumbos find common ground with lemony gnocchi seared in olive oil, where small plates of house made spaghetti come outfitted with fried poached eggs, where parmesan beignets stand in for croutons on carefully composed spinach salads." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Heron Lakes Great Blue
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus3500 North Victory Blvd.portland, or(4 stars, Robert Trent Jones Jr.) One of the great munis anywhere. The back nine has enough water and quirks to swallow up any good start.

properties.name: Heron Lakes Greenback
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus3500 North Victory Blvd.portland, or(3 1/2 stars, Robert Trent Jones Jr.) Te original 18, more pedestrian than great blue and more predictalbe but still way above average for a muni.

properties.name: Hidden Lake
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusScenic and peaceful lake in the Kenai Wildlife Refuge with a pleasant campground at one end.

properties.name: Higgins
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1239 SW Broadway, Portland, OR

properties.name: Higgins Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1239 SW Broadway, Portland, ORRenowned and rightfully so. Higgins is one of Portland\'s top restaurants, specializing in local ingredients. Highly recommended

properties.name: High Cedars
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusOrting, WAA few memorable holes beneath old trees and a number of fairly pedestrian ones. Still an enjoyable round when the course is dry.

properties.name: Highland Links
properties.description: Posted by Edbogusingonish beach, ns, canada(5 stars, Stanley Thompson, 1939) Simply one of the world\'s great courses winding through wetlands and forest along the famed Cape Breton Island Cabot Trail. The views are stunning, the golf challenging.

properties.name: Hiking Barclay Lake
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus (4 miles RT)Very easy hike on level ground to a crowded lake beneath towering Baring Peak. Good fishing

properties.name: Hiking Byron Glacier
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  An easy hike up a flat gravel trail gets you close to the snout of the Byron Glacier. Scramble over rocky moraines and snowfields right up to the ice.

properties.name: Ho Ho Seafood Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 653 S Weller St, Seattle, WAOne of my old standbys. Try the garlic crab, crispy fish or spicy long beans. Try whatever\'s fresh on the list of specials posted on the wall.

properties.name: Homestead FArms
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus115 Homestead Rd, Lynden, WA(3 stars, Bill Overdorf 1993) I don\'t know why but this course has always bugged me. Too many hidden hazards. Maybe I just need to play it well once. Nice condos to rent along the fairway, though.

properties.name: Hong Kong Museum of History
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "This museum is a testament to Hong Kong’s determination not just to survive (see the extraordinary film scenes of typhoons, the Japanese occupation and Red Guard campaigns), but also to prosper (behold a replica of an old street lined with a pawn shop, tea house, post office, bank, grocery store and Chinese pharmacy)" NYT 4/5/07

properties.name: Horn Rapids
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Richland, WA(3 1/2 stars) A true desert course east of Richland. I\'ve always enjoyed it, but it is target golf at its best and worst.

properties.name: Horstman House
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: Hotel Adagio
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 550 Geary St., San Francisco, CASepia rooms are more than adequate, the internet access a little spotty.

properties.name: Hotel Allegro
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 171 West Randolph St., Chicago, IL"In the Loop theater district, Hotel Allegro (171 West Randolph Street, 312-236-0123; www.allegrochicago.com) offers 483 rooms from 89 night in an Art Deco style and in shades of coral and pink. "

properties.name: Hotel Beacon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2130 Broadway, New York City, NYFamily friendly hotel with reasonable suites in a great neighborhood.

properties.name: Hotel Boulderado
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2115 13th Street, Boulder, CO

properties.name: Hotel Don Bruno
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus A good place to base a trip to see the nearby monarch butterfly sanctuary. Angangueo is a scenic little town wedged into a canyon. The hotel climbs the steep hillside for five floors. Some of the rooms have fireplaces but are otherwise simply furnished. Adequate food in the attached restaurant. No credit cards.

properties.name: Hotel Mesa de Santa Rosa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Gorgeous colonial hotel where rooms surround a courtyard pool that was ice cold while we were there. Great location on one of Queretaro\'s central plazas. Friendly staff. Recommended.

properties.name: Hotel Milburn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 242 West 76th St., New York, NY

properties.name: Hotel Rex
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 562 Sutter St, San Francisco, CAArty and old with comfortable if cozy rooms. I think the squiggles on the wall are art, not graffiti. Classy old lobby bar.

properties.name: Hotel de la Soledad
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Hotel de la Soledad (52-443-312-1888; www.hsoledad.com), a half block off the main square, has colonial-style rooms, a grassy courtyard and antique coaches in the galleries. Rooms start at 1,100 pesos (about 00 at 11.13 pesos to ). " NYT 9/17/06

properties.name: House of Nanking
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 919 Kearny St, San Francisco, CAClassic hole in the wall Chinese place where folks line up along the sidewalk for a cramped table where they just ask the waiter to bring whatever the cook has ready. Fantastic.

properties.name: Hutong
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"With its striking lighting and floor-to-ceiling harbor views, this restaurant bears no resemblance to those old, smelly Beijing alleys of the same name. Try the crispy de-boned lamb rib or the soft-shell crabs in a mound of Sichuan, washed down, if you are splurging, with a bottle of Australia’s famed Penfolds Grange shiraz." NYT 4/6/07

properties.name: Il Fornaio
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 600 Pine Street, Seattle, WANice gimmick here with regional menus that change monthly. But at the end of the day this feels like the chain that it is and the food never escapes the realm of the average.

properties.name: Illegal Pete's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1447 Pearl Street, Boulder, COBusy and informal Mexican food, ordered at the counter.

properties.name: Imai
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 8300 Wilshire Blvd., Los AngelesDelicious sushi and Japanes grilled skewers called kushi. Lunch specials are reasonable and well-rounded. Reccomended.

properties.name: Indian Creek
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus3605 Brookside Rd, Hood River, OR(3 1/2 stars) I play better here than anywhere else, so no wonder I enjoy it. A short course winding through orchanrds and housing with a number of extremely scenic holes.

properties.name: Indian Summer
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus5900 Troon Lane SE, Olympia, WA(4 1/2 stars, Peter Thompson) Oh how I wish I could still play this one. Semi-public whenit first opened, the challenging course through wetlands and tall firs is a gem.

properties.name: Ingrid's Village Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Small, cozy deli style breakfast place. The meusli and the bread are homemade, the bratwurst had been sitting around for awhile. One of the few true breakfast cafe\'s in town.

properties.name: Inlet Tower Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1200 L St, Anchorage, AKA converted apartment building with adequate rooms that all feature a mini kitchen. The decor in the lobby is...well...somewhat reminiscent of a French whorehouse. Staff is friendly if sometimes uninformed.

properties.name: Inn at Kent Falls
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 107 Kent Cornwall Rd., Kent, CT"Located in an 18th-century farmhouse, this six-room inn with Internet access features delicious homemade breakfasts. The Lakes Suite has a claw-foot bathtub in front of a candlelit fireplace. Rooms from 95." T & L April 2007

properties.name: Inn of Chicago
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 162 East Ohio, Chicago, IL"For a more modest stay, but still in the heart of the city, try the Inn of Chicago (also known as the Best Western Inn of Chicago, 162 East Ohio Street, 800-557-2378; www.innofchicago.com). Its 357 rooms begin at 29 a night, and looking out from the 22nd-floor rooftop terrace is an easy way to conduct your own architectural study of the city’s skyline." NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Inn on the Beach
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   1175 S. Seaward Ave., Ventura, CA"Straightforward name, straightforward premise — three floors and 24 neat, simple Victorian-style rooms with fireplaces, parked smack-dab on the sand, facing Santa Cruz and Anacapa Islands. A favored getaway for locals — who know that third-floor rooms with patios and views can be had for right around 00 midweek. Ask about the dunes if you\'re booking a first-floor room; built-up sand can block some views but does offer extra privacy. From 09; www.innonthebeachventura.com or 805/652-2000" Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: Ipanema Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1225 First Ave. Seattle, WAAll you can eat off the spit with a varied buffet of salads, meats and other accompaniments. In the upper echelon of the Brazilian Grill craze

properties.name: Isobune
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1737 Post St, San Francisco, CAThe orginal sushi boat restaurant has unique sushi creation float by. Now a chain around the Bay Area, this was the first. Expect a wait to get it.

properties.name: Ivindo National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Ivindo National Park is the site of Langoué Bai, an isolated clearing remarkable for its large concentration of elephants and gorillas. Also within Ivindo\'s borders are the Kongou and Mingouli waterfalls, the most impressive in Central Africa." Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Jalisco's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1205 NE 65th St, Seattle, WARun of the mill Mexican all the way.

properties.name: James Chicago
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 55 East Ontario Street, Chicago, IL"With a sleek design and a boutique feel, the James Chicago (55 East Ontario Street, 312-337-1000; www.jameshotels.com) opened last spring just off busy Rush Street, not far from the Magnificent Mile. The James’s 297 rooms start at 50 a night, but suites can go as high as ,000 a night" NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Jardiniere
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 300 Grove St., San Francisco, CA, United States"A special anniversary? An important business dinner? A tax refund? Any one of these is a good reason to head to Jardinière. The restaurant takes its name from its chef-owner, Traci Des Jardins, and the sophisticated interior, with its eye-catching oval atrium and curving staircase, is the work of famed designer Pat Kuleto. The equally sophisticated menu changes daily but regularly includes such high-style plates as potato gnocchi with Dungeness crab and New York steak with roasted vegetables and creamed nettles. Cheese snobs will appreciate the glassed-in cheese-aging chamber in the rear of the restaurant. Reservations essential." Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Jax Fish House
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1539 17th St 80202Seafood in Denver. Yes, at Jax Fish House. A selection of fresh oysters from both coasts...and blackened catfish over collard greens from a third coast.

properties.name: Jazz Alley
