properties.description: Posted by Edbogus OK you don\'t come here for the food. The music is great, up-close seating just don\'t try to dance. But the menu has always been overpriced and underperforming...for consistancy, at least, this kitchen gets high marks.

properties.name: Jean Georges
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1 Central Park W, New York, NY

properties.name: Jimmy's Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Busy fish shack with a wide variety of fried and blackened seafood in mountainous portions. Pies and cakes galore. Sit on a barge and feast.

properties.name: Joel Robuchon at the Mansion
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "From the first moment of the meal when the 17 breads are wheeled up to your table, the experience unfurls seamlessly. Your bill is enormous, but if you\'re on a winning streak, you probably won\'t care." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Jordan's at the Claremont Resort and Spa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 41 Tunnel Rd, Berkeley, CASpacious restaurant in the Claremont features a sumptuous Sunday brunch featuring everything from catfish with cucumber dill sauce, to tender prime rib and dim sum.

properties.name: Kafue National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "In Zambia\'s oldest and largest park, Kafue, the best game viewing is on the Busanga Plains, which support roan and sable antelopes, elephants, lions, and cheetahs. " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Kafunta River Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Expect warm hospitality, great food, and good value at Kafunta River Lodge, reached by ferry from South Luangwa Park. The swimming pool and natural hot tub are a bonus for weary travelers (260-6-246046; luangwa.com; doubles, 20, all-inclusive)." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Kalaloch Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Aberdeen, Wa"Picture a cluster of weathered gray cabins perched on a grassy bluff above a wind- and rain-swept beach, and you\'ve got the drift of Kalaloch Lodge. A step above basic, the cabins have knotty-pine paneling, wood stoves, compact kitchens, and, most important, big picture windows opening onto views of the Pacific. Steps lead down to the beach, strewn with huge piles of driftwood and massive tree trunks. Nab a window table in the lodge dining room for the excellent cedar-plank wild king salmon. 44 cabins from 69; www.visitkalaloch.com or 866/525-2562" Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: Kampala Sheraton
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "The Kampala Sheraton and its beautiful gardens offer a grandeur that\'s rare in this part of the world (256-41-344-591; starwoodhotels.com; doubles, 45)." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Kananaskis (Mt. Kidd)
properties.description: Posted by Edboguskananaskis alberta(4 1/2 Stars) Gorgeous scenery on the slightly more spectacular of the two Kananaskis cpurses which wind along a river valley beneath steep peaks.

properties.name: Kananaskis (Mt. Loretts)
properties.description: Posted by Edboguskananaskis alberta(4 stars) The lesser of the two Kanaskis courses is till better than most.

properties.name: Kayak Point
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus15711 Marine Drive NE, Stanwood, WA(3 1/2 stars) Once a premier golf course in the state, I now find myself frustrated every time I play by either the pace of play or the several bad holes.

properties.name: Kenwanda
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 14030 Kenwanda Dr, Snohomish, WA(2 stars) A dogpatch on a ridgetop above the Snohomish Valley

properties.name: Khana Khazana
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Kampala\'s stylish Khana Khazana may well be one of the world\'s best Indian restaurants (256-41-233-049; entrées, –6)" Conde Nast May 2006 20 Acacia Avenue Kololo

properties.name: Kingfish Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  602 19th Ave. E, SEattle, WAHearty portions of authentic Southern Food attracts a crowd with lines out the door at opening time a common sight. The food is a bit overrated in my book, but still very good. The pan-fried catfish was moist and flaky, the greens tangy and succulent. But the coconut cake, while huge, was a bit of a gut bomb.

properties.name: Kokanee Springs
properties.description: Posted by Edboguscrawford bay, bc(3 1/2 stars) Great value just across Kootenay Lake.

properties.name: Kokkari Estiatoria Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 200 Jackson Street, San Francisco, CA, 94111Sprawling brick lined interior with a full rotisserie on dislplay houses meals fit for Greek gods. From the house made Tsatziki and Baba Ghanoush to the fresh seafood in a variety of preparations and fresh house made yoghurt with honey, candied walnuts and figs, one of the most heavenly desserts I\'ve ever tasted.

properties.name: Kona Country Club (Mauka)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Kona, Hi(3 1/2 stars) A fun rolling course up in the hills above Keauhou Bay with great twilight rates. The newer and better of the two courses here.

properties.name: Kona Country Club (Ocean)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Kona, Hi(3 1/2 stars, William Bell 1966) This one has the oceanfront holes, but is a little older and less interesting than the newer Mauka course

properties.name: Koolau
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus45-550 Kionaole Road, Kaneohe, HI(4 2tars) Bills itself as the toughest golf course in America. Lots of forced carries of jungle ravines. It actually gets a lottle old after awhile. I think I shot a 120.

properties.name: L'Auberge Carmel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  Monte Verde St., Carmel, CA"From Thai inspired riffs on sates and spring rolls to Syrah braised Wagyu beef short ribs and silky olive oil poached tilefish that appears to have washed ashore in Meyer lemon foam, the dishes on the tasting menu reveal a mastery of pure focused flavors and faraway cuisines." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: L'Enfant Plaza Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 480 Lenfant Plz Sw, Washington, DCGreat views in every direction and comfortable, even plush rooms just about make up for the sterile neighborhood.

properties.name: L'Etoile
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 25 N. Pinckney Street, Madison, WI"This restaurant continues to be warm, welcoming and unpretentious and the food continues to be completely satisfying." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: La Belle Vie
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 510 Groveland Avenue, Minneapolis, MN

properties.name: La Casa Gelato
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1033 Venables St, Vancouver, BCrotating 208 flavors of gelato (out of more than 500). The favorites? \'\'People really like Ferrero Rocher, chocolate fudge brownie, lemon,\'\' a server behind the counter told me on a recent visit. What don\'t they like? \'\'Well, they try flavors like durian and garlic. But they don\'t buy them.\'

properties.name: La Paloma Cottages
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Beacon Street, Avalon, CACharming on the outside, but a dump on the inside. Some call it quaint charm. I call it a ripoff.

properties.name: La Ruta Moskitia
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Said one guest of this locally owned tour collective in the Río Plátano Biosphere Reserve, "The trip was a great opportunity to see such an untouched spot, but it caps it off to know that our money is going to the right places." Seven communities run the excursions: Kayak through a pine savanna under monkeys and toucans, watch Garifuna dancing, go nighttime crocodile spotting, volunteer with a sea turtle project, and see ancient petroglyphs while guided by likely descendants of the carvers. In addition to what they charge travelers, members of the collective earn bonuses for improving the palm-thatched guest cabanas and other parts of the tourism infrastructure. Ten percent of profits also goes to conservation and community development (504-443-1276; larutamoskitia.com; eight days, 10–95 per person." Conde Nast Sept 2006

properties.name: La Vite E Belle
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus2411 2nd Ave, Seattle, WATasty food, deliberate service. Thin crusted pizza, ample salads and interesting pasta dishes.

properties.name: Lake Spanaway
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 15602 Pacific Ave. , Tacoma, WA(3 stars) The first place I broke 100. A fine old muni also gets too slow for words. Relax Jake, It\'s onlhy Spanaway.

properties.name: Langoue Bai Camp
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "In Ivindo National Park, a research station has been transformed into the rustic Langoué Bai Camp, run by the Wildlife Conservation Society. A network of paths extends from the camp, making the park\'s gorillas easy to spy on (31-26-370-5567; doubles, 80)." Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Lantern Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 423 W. Franklin St., Chapel Hill, NC"Lantern\'s menu is dedicated to Asia. But this is not fusion cuisine, the menu roams the region, offering Vietnamese style summer rolls, Thai salads, tandoori lamb and tea smoke chicken." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Larchmont
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus3200 Fort Missoula Road, missoula, mt(2 1/2 stars) Not much, a flat basic muni in Missoula.

properties.name: Las Vegas Paiute (Snow Mountain)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus10325 Nu-Wav Kaiv Blvd., Las Vegas, NV(4 1/2 stars, Pete Dye) Hidden bunkers with trademark railroad ties make this course feel a little more tricked out than the Sun Mountain Course. Full of optical illusions, a great golf experience.

properties.name: Las Vegas Paiute (Sun Mountain)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus10325 Nu-Wav Kaiv Blvd., Las Vegas, NV(4 1/2 Stars, Pete Dye) Simply the best desert golf complex I\'ve played. This is the more straightforward of the two (now three ) courses out here. No houses hemming in fairways, just challenging golg with frequent wind in the wide open desert.

properties.name: Lavender Hill Spa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1015 Foothill Blvd., Calistoga, CA

properties.name: Le Bernardin
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 155 W 51st St, New York, NY"There is a reason why Le Bernardin is contantly rated at the top of every New York restaurant poll. It may be the most perfect combination of France and America that can possibly be acheived in a restaurant." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Le Reve
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 152 E. Pecan St., San Antonio, TX"The best restaurant in Texas...modern American French style food...look for dishes like foie gras custard with warm vegetables, poached oysters in wasabi beurre blanc with braised cucumbers and caviar." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Legendary Noodle
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 4191 Main St., Vancouver, BCA window on the kitchen has seldom been so inspiring. Watch the chef de jour hack peices of dough into a boiling wok for thick stubby noodles, or roll his own green onion pancakes. While noodles and dumplings are the order of business here, side dishes like garlicky pea vines also excelled. A great culinary experience at a shockingly affordable price. "Legendary" may be the apt term to describe this dining experience. Noodles are created before your very eyes by an industrious gent who manipulates the dough at warp speed, spinning and twirling until lo, ropes of fresh pasta are produced. These are topped with full-flavor broths, enriched with cilantro, garlic-spiked lamb shanks, or barbecued pork, or eaten cold with chicken. Given the skill level, you\'d expect them to charge huge amounts for these noodles, but no—this place is very cheap" Conde Nast

properties.name: Legion Memorial
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus144 West Marine View drive, Everett, WA(3 stars, 1933) Old muni got a facelift. I always seem to play well here so it must be easy.

properties.name: Les Amis
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 568 Sacramento Street, San Francisco, CA

properties.name: Lewis River
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus3209 Lewis River Road, Woodland, WA(2 stars,) Flat course along the Lewis River .

properties.name: Likoma Island
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Likoma Island, accessible by public ferry just once a week (or by chartered boat or plane), is well worth a visit to see Chipyela, a quaint town with cobbled roads and a stone church, built by Anglican missionaries in 1906, that is nearly as large as Westminster Cathedral. " Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Links at Kuilima
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 57-049 Kuilima Dr, Kahuku, HI(4 1/2 stars) A gorgeous, wind blown Hawaiian links course on Oahu\'s North Shore

properties.name: Lipoma Firs
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus18615 110th Ave E, Puyallup, WA(2 1/2 stars) I know I played it but I can\'t remember it exept that I recall a rock dinged my sand wedge.

properties.name: Liwonde National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Liwonde National Park teems with hippos, crocodiles, and elephants." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Loango Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "In Loango National Park, the new Loango Lodge has seven bungalows with large bathrooms, comfortable beds, air-conditioning, and a porch with views of the Mpvie River. A motorized canoe ferries guests into the park, where waiting Land Rovers take you on game drives to see forest elephants and bush pigs (31-26-370-5567;) 65 double

properties.name: Loango National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "At dusk each night, a procession of elephants, buffalo, and even the occasional hippo emerges on "Petit Loango Beach, a 60-mile stretch of white sand in Loango National Park. The park is one of the few places in the world where you can observe these and other big beasts—including chimpanzees and humpback whales—in such close proximity" Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Locke-Ober
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3 Winter Place, Boston, MA"Dishes like rum and tobacco smoked salmon, hot foie gras with maraschino cherries, whiskeyed calve\'s liver and charcoal grilled duck breast have converted even the chilliest Brahmins who now share the room with young fans of cutting edge cooking" Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Lombard Street
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The block-long "Crookedest Street in the World" makes eight switchbacks down the east face of Russian Hill between Hyde and Leavenworth streets. You take in super views of North Beach and Coit Tower whether you walk or drive---though if you\'re the one behind the wheel, you\'d better keep your eye on the road lest you become yet another of the many folks who ram the garden barriers" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Lope Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "In Lopé National Park, the cabanas of the new Lopé Hotel are set on a hill above the Offoué River and face Mount Brazza. The hotel offers daily excursions with a naturalist (241-77-85-61; doubles, 1–2)." Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Lope National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Lopé National Park, reached by a four-hour train ride from Libreville, is known for its gorillas, troops of rare and brilliantly colored mandrill monkeys, and 400 bird species. The neighboring Offoué River can be explored in traditional dugout canoes. Fans of Albert Schweitzer will want to visit the small riverside town of Lambaréné to see the hospital he built and a museum dedicated to his work." Conde Nast June 2006

properties.name: Los Mirasoles
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Mirasoles (52-443-317 5775, www.losmirasoles.com), a chic restaurant in an ancient building three blocks west of the main square, provides a generous sampling of Michoacán fare, including corn tamale soup, churipu (broth of beef bones), chile chilaca and chongos (a sweet, milky dessert). For dinner, expect to spend 200 pesos per person or more" NYT Sept 17, 2006

properties.name: Lower Zambezi National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "With its thick woodlands and gentle waterways, the Lower Zambezi National Parkis best seen by boat or, better still, by canoe." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Lyman Ochards (Player)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Middlefield, CT(3 1/2 stars, Gary Player) More scenic, hillier and much quirkier than the Jones course, it is not for everyone. I\'ve always enjoyed it, though, with the exception of number 8, an uncomfortable par 5 that always sends me toward double digits.

properties.name: Lyman Orchards (Jones)
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Middlefield, CT(3 1/2 stars, Robert Trent Jones) A solid, if unspectacular, Trent Jones offering with its own amen corner around a series of water hazardsonthe back nine.

properties.name: Lyme Regis Ltd
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 43 N Main St, Kent, CT"the owner of Lyme Regis, Ltd. (43 N. Main St.; 860/927-3330), makes twice-yearly visits to England to select her quirky assortment of oddities, from figural inkwells and snuffboxes to vintage valentines." Travel & Liesure April 2007

properties.name: MacArthur Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 607 Front Street, San Francisco, CAAdequate if somewhat overpriced lunch spot with a passable steak salad. Pales compared to its neighbor, Kokkari.

properties.name: Madison Country Club
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusWest Wharf Rd. Madison, CT(3 1/2 stars) I\'ve probably played this course, in pieces at least, as much as any in the world,. Mostly sneaking on. So much a part of me that I can;t really separate the quality of golf except to say that it has gotten better and better over the years.

properties.name: Magnolia Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1002 Ninth St., Durham, NC"The menu is rife with unweildy sounding dishes like octopus salami with farmer\'s market vegetables, romaine in ceasar dressing with overnight tomatoes, roasted olives and pine nuts" Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Makalei
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus72-3890hawaii belt road, kailua, hi(3 1/2 stars) An up and down mountain course. I\'d like to try this one again.

properties.name: Man Ho Temple
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Hong Kong Island\'s oldest and most important temple was built in the 1840s and is named after its two principal deities: Man, the god of literature, who is dressed in red and holds a calligraphy brush; and Mo, the god of war, wearing a green robe and holding a sword. Ironically, Mo finds patronage in both the police force (shrines in his honor can be found in all Hong Kong police stations today) and the infamous triad secret societies. Two ornately carved sedan chairs in the temple were once used during festivals to carry the statues of the gods around the neighborhood. But what makes the temple particularly memorable are the giant incense coils hanging from the ceiling, imparting a fragrant, smoky haze--these are purchased by patrons seeking fulfillment of their wishes, such as good health or a successful business deal, and may burn as long as 3 weeks." Frommer\'s

properties.name: Manhattan Beach Marriott
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   1400 Parkview Ave, Manhattan Beach, CAMassive hotel just miles from LAX with a 9 hole golf course and all the rest of the trimmings. When we stayed the staff was somewhat surly and unhelpful, and the place was overflowing with a hiphop competition that had teenagers running the halls till all hours of the night.

properties.name: Manresa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 320 Village Lane, Los Gatos, CASlightly funky as only a Bay Area place can be and seriously experimental, Manresa is an utterly American place. The influences come from every continent and the tasting menu might offer smokes foie gras in one course, corn croquettes in another, sashimi topped with cavier in a third and Dungeness crab tossed in Indian spices to follow." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Marco's Supperclub
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2510 First Avenue, Seattle, WALovely terrace out back. New lunch menu features the famous fried sage leaves, but I would stick to dinner here which is varied and usually excellent.

properties.name: Masa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 10 Columbus Circle, New York, NY"An experience of intense purity, this is an introduction to sashimi and sushi as high art." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Masa's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 648 bush street, san francisco"Although the toque has been passed to several chefs since the death of founding chef Masa Kobayashi, the two-decade-old restaurant, with its chocolate-brown walls, white fabric ceiling, and red-silk-shaded lanterns, is still one of the country\'s most celebrated food temples. Chef Gregory Short, who worked alongside Thomas Keller at the famed French Laundry for seven years, is at the helm these days, and his tasting menus of four, six, and nine courses are pleasing diners and critics alike. All menus are laced with fancy ingredients -- truffles, foie gras, squab -- and priced accordingly (9-20). " Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Mattawang
properties.description: Posted by Edbogustownship line road, belle mead, nj(2 1/2 stars) Really two courses. The front nine is open and not too difficult. The back nine is a bear, long, excruciatingly so from the lbues.

properties.name: Mediterranean Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1002 Walnut St., Boulder, COPopular patio and tapas but my salad was mediocre. Main dishes are better with a tangy pork saltimbocca over wilted greens and an assortment of paellas

properties.name: Mexican Fine Arts Center Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  1852 w 19th st, chicago il"look at a range of Mexican cultural objects" NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Mfuwe Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Mfuwe Lodge has 18 pleasant bungalows overlooking a lagoon (260-6-245041; mfuwelodge.com; doubles, 80, all-inclusive)" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Michel Richard Citronelle
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3000 M St.NW, Washington D.C."In a dining room defined by a mood wall bathed in richly colored light, Richard\'s fans have been known to break into applause for dishes like his custard and caviar filled eggshell." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Michy's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 6927 Biscayne Boulevard, Miami, FL

properties.name: Millenium Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   "Mayor Richard M. Daley’s sensory-overloading masterpiece along Lake Michigan. The park, which opened in 2004, a tad late for the start of the millennium (and vastly over budget), is still worth seeing. Stop at the band shell, blossoming with giant ribbons of stainless steel, designed by Frank Gehry, and stand beneath the silver “Bean” sculpture (the artist, Anish Kapoor, prefers its real name, “Cloud Gate”) to see your own reflection against the city’s skyline." NYT 09/15/06

properties.name: Millennium Harvest House
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1345 28th Street, Boulder, COSprawling hotel complex near the University. Has all the trimmings but feels like something out of the small town West. In carries none of Boulder\'s hipness or pretensions. Is that good or bad?

properties.name: Miss Saigon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3057 M St NW, Washington, DCGood food and service at this Georgetown Vietnamese place...soft shell crab on a salad of greens and onions and the green papaya salad were both standouts

properties.name: Mission
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2325 California Ave SW, Seattle, WashingtonDarkly lit with lanterns hanging from the ceiling, this restaurant features adventurous latin and Spanish food. All the dishes have a unique, and usually successful, twist. Friendly atmosphere although the scene changes to more of a tequila drinking crowd later in the evening.

properties.name: Mixx Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1200 L Street, Anchorage, AKA more than adequate hotel restaurant that seems to draw outside clientele as well. A rack of lamb with cherry sauce was excellent. Recommended.

properties.name: Moe's Broadway Bagels
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2650 Broadway, Boulder, CODelicious bagels in various breakfast and lunch combos. Pumpernickel with egg, cheese and bacon was my choice.

properties.name: Monticello Inn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 127 Ellis St, San Francisco, CAMonticello Inn (415) 392-8800

properties.name: Morne Trois Pitons National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  dominicaAerial tram takes visitors for over a mile over and through the rain forest canopy

properties.name: Murchison Falls National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "In the center of the country is Murchison Falls National Park, historically Uganda\'s star attraction, where the Nile funnels through a rift valley in dramatic cascades, attracting elephants, lions, giraffes, and buffalo. Unfortunately, both the U.S. State Department and Britain\'s Foreign & Commonwealth Office currently advise travelers to avoid the area because of increased rebel activity and sporadic attacks on tourists." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Musashi
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Busy sushi place on at 780 Denman. Huge slabs of hamachi and toro for a reasonable price...but you pay with your time...more than an hour to prepare our modest to go order.

properties.name: Museo Regional Michoacano
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "The Museo Regional Michoacano (52-443-312-0407) showcases the history, geology, flora and fauna of the state. Closed Mondays; free." NYT 9/16/06

properties.name: Museum of Contemporary Art
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  220 East Chicago Ave Chicago Il"In the blur of sales and shopping bags, the Museum of Contemporary Art (220 East Chicago Avenue, 312-280-2660; www.mcachicago.org) makes the Magnificent Mile worth seeing, even for those who hate to shop." NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Myth
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 470 Pacific Ave., San Francisco, CAStylish, eclectic and upscale but friendly and accesible as well. The food is spectacular; from the oysters with tobiko and cilantro lime sauce to the cinnamon stick creme brulee. Fresh seafood from across the Pacific. High recommended!

properties.name: Namib-Naukluft National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "The world\'s oldest desert, the Namib, meets the icy Atlantic in Namib-Naukluft National Park. Explore by foot, hot-air balloon, quad-bike, even surfboard (to ride the dunes, not waves). Nearby Swakopmund is a lively seaside resort, but for a dose of desert solitude, stay in one of the park\'s excellent lodges or camps " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Nana
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "This is Dallas in an expansive mood, a room with a view on the 27th floor and a cerebral chef with a Barcelona background." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: New Main Buffet
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus It is what it is; a Chinese buffet. But it is massive and has some truly tasty selections...and cubes of jello to boot.

properties.name: New Peach Garden
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1111 Washington Ave., Golden, COAverage Chinese restaurant in every way in downtown Golden, from the cheap lunch specials to the bright, syrupy presentations.

properties.name: New Seoul Barbecue
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 9902 Garden Grove Boulevard, Garden Grove, CASumptuous buffet of Korean side dishes accompany a full array of marinated meat and seafood to grill at your table. I loved it the first time. I got sick the second.

properties.name: New York Pizza
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  Passable pies at this family friendly pizza joing in the Bridal Trails shopping center. Don\'t fill up on the hot garlic rolls

properties.name: Ngamba Island
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusNgamba is where Jane Goodall established a reserve for orphaned chimpanzees

properties.name: Nihiwatu
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "After a flight from Bali and a 90-minute drive, my first view is of a mile-and-a-half-long crescent of sparkling sand, bordered by dense forest on one side and a curl of foamy sea on the other. I\'m led past the yoga studio, the infinity pool, and the spa villa to my air-conditioned bungalow—one of just ten on 440 acres. Soon after, I meet my fellow guests over lunch in the sandy-floored open-air dining area. Most are here primarily to surf but also to experience the local culture (several attended a funeral—complete with a water buffalo sacrifice—the day before I arrived). When the waves aren\'t up to snuff, there are plenty of other things to do: horseback rides along the beach, rain forest treks to a stunning waterfall, massages, fishing, diving and snorkeling right off the beach, and visits to local villages and markets. Nihiwatu bills itself as a luxury surfing enclave—although the staff are notable more for their constant smiles than for white-glove service. Still, the raw, undeveloped beauty here easily makes up for the fact that the bartender serves my cosmopolitan in a highball glass—and it\'s the color of a Long Island iced tea. (62-361-757-149; nihiwatu.com; doubles, 90)." Conde Nast Sept. 2006

properties.name: No. 9 Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 9 Park St, boston, ma 02108"...an elegantly understated room overlooking the Boston Commons and in the shadow of the Old State House, the prune stuffed gnocchi are so light they practically float out of the kitchen; the confit pork shoulder with tomato marmelade and lupini beans is a symphony of deep rich flavors" Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Nova Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  312 East Main, Bozeman, MTBustling breakfast and lunch place in downtown Bozeman served a more than adequate pear and gorgonzola salad.

properties.name: Nyungwe Forest
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "chimpanzees, Angola colobus monkeys, and golden monkeys—are plentiful in Nyungwe Forest" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Oceanaire Seafood Room
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1201 F Street NW, Washington, DCUpsale seafood chain specializes in fresh local catches. Crabcakes were outstanding. Prices are not.

properties.name: Olson Mansion
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: Orange
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3231 North Clark Street, Chicago, IL"As with many things in the Lakeview neighborhood, north of downtown, lines often form outside Orange (3231 North Clark Street, 773-549-4400) when it’s time for weekend brunch, so it’s a good idea to get an early start. Orange offers a mix of homey atmosphere and dressed-up food like green eggs and ham (.95), a surprisingly appealing take on the Dr. Seuss fantasy with the enormous help of pesto" NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Orchard Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 665 Bush Street, san francisco, caComfortable boutique hotel with DVD players in the room and high speed internet.

properties.name: Oriental Institute
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  1155 East 58th Street, Chicago, IL"Wander the Oriental Institute (1155 East 58th Street, 773-702-9514; www.oi.uchicago.edu) for its collection of objects from the ancient Middle East. " NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Orso
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 737 West 5th Ave, Anchorage, AKItalian restaurant that features creative renditions of Alaska seafood. Popular and quite good. I had the cashew encrusted halibut with golden raisin and caper sauce over red pepper cous cous.

properties.name: Osteria La Spiga
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1429 12th ave e, 98122Spacious new digs are open and bustling. The food is interesting...but everything seems a little on the starchy side. An antipasti selection of meats was unimaginative and the riccota gnocchi were coronary pills.

properties.name: P.F. Chang's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 400 pine st. seattle, waA chain but one of the better one\'s. The food\'s usually at least interesting, if a litytle on the bland side. This one\'s right in the Westlake Mall

properties.name: Pagosa Springs Inn & Suites
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 519 Village Drive, Pagosa Springs, CO

properties.name: Palace of Fine Arts
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "At first glance this stunning, rosy rococo palace seems to be from another world, and indeed, it\'s the sole survivor of the many tinted-plaster structures built for the 1915 Panama-Pacific International Exposition. The expo lasted for 288 days, and the buildings extended about a mile along the shore. Bernard Maybeck designed this faux Roman Classic beauty, which was reconstructed in concrete and reopened in 1967. The massive columns, great rotunda (dedicated to the glory of Greek culture), and swan-filled lagoon have been used in countless fashion layouts and films" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Paley's Place
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1204 nw 21st 97209"Dip succulent razor clams into a tangy sauce gribiche, polish of bucatini, morels and asparagus napped with melted marrow or savor the brilliant pairing of rhubarb-fennel salad with fennel pollen dusted pork tenderloin" Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Pancake Cottage
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 118 Catalina Ave., Avalon, CAMountainous breakfasts including a "healthy" 7 grain pancake with a pile of strawberries and whipped cream. Reccomended for the hungry.

properties.name: Pantheon
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"This monumental temple, in use throughout its history, was erected by the Roman consul Marcus Agrippa in 27 B.C., rebuilt by Hadrian after a fire in about 125 A.D., and consecrated as a Christian church in 609 A.D. It stands as a pure expression of classical proportions; the coffered dome—with a heaven-gazing oculus at its apex—and colonnaded portico have inspired generations of architects." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Papillote Wilderness Retreat
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus dominica"Tucked into the emerald hillside above Trafalgar Village….reason enough to go to the island…has own hot springs and botanical garden" NYT

properties.name: Parc National Des Volcans
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Most of Rwanda\'s tourists come for a glimpse of the mountain gorillas that populate the jungles of the Parc National des Volcans, in the country\'s northwest. All of the estimated 650 mountain gorillas living in the wild are in this region, a habitat shared by Rwanda, Uganda, and the Congo. Thanks in large part to the heroic conservation efforts of American primatologist Dian Fossey—whose life and mysterious death were the basis for the 1988 film Gorillas in the Mist—the gorilla population has stabilized and even increased. Their survival is especially remarkable considering the prolonged periods of regional instability when monitoring and anti-poaching activities were suspended. For diehard Fossey fans, a side trip to her grave can be arranged during a gorilla trek" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Parker's New American Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2801 Bridge Avenue, Cleveland, OH

properties.name: Pasta?
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus320 University Avenue, Palo Alto, CA

properties.name: Pasta?
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 320 University Avenue, Palo Alto, CADelightful Italian bistro with authentic flavors. The menu is standard fare with a selection of pasta, veal marsala etc. But the execution is perfect and the ambiance, with tables on Palo Alto\'s main drag, is informal and pleasant.

properties.name: Peak Lookout
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Before the Peak Tram was built, this spot was a rest stop for men carrying rich Britons in sedan chairs from sweltering Central to their cooler Peak homes. It has since been turned into a colonial-style restaurant, known as much for its views as for its food. Book a table outdoors, with a view of the southern side of the island, and start with the giant combination platter: Thai spring roll, fried soft-shell crab, salmon on Indian nan bread, Mexican chicken quesadillas. That will give you an idea of this charming restaurant’s international menu (there are hamburgers and sushi, too)." NYT 4/6/07

properties.name: Pepperdock
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  2618 Alki Ave. S.W, seattle, waA standard beach front burger joint, greasier than some, less greasy than others. My son loves the bright pink and blue cotton candy ice cream. Yum!

properties.name: Per Se
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 10 Columbus Circle, New York, NY"Food is so luxurious, so resolutely creative, that eating becomes a wonderful adventure." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Planet Sushi
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 380 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY, 10024More than adequate sushi at this spacious Upper West Side restaurant. Some original rolls featuring multi-colored sobiko.

properties.name: Po Lin Monastary
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"This monastery on the 1,700-foot-high Ngong Ping plateau, features a 112-foot-high statue of a seated Buddha, made of bronze sheets over a steel frame. Admission to the 101-year-old monastery is free, but to climb up to the Buddha, visitors are encouraged to buy a coupon for a vegetarian meal in a nearby pavilion" NYT

properties.name: Polana Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "In Maputo, a night or two at the elegant old-world Polana is a must. Journey back to a time of decadent colonial luxury as you sun yourself by the grand pool overlooking the Bay of Maputo while savoring mega-sized prawns dipped in peri-peri (a hot chili sauce) and a glass of viňho verde" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Primrose Campground
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusVery pleasant and scenic campground at the Seward end of Kenai Lake.

properties.name: Providence
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 5955 Melrose Ave, LA, CA 90038

properties.name: Queen Anne Specialty Market
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 300 2nd Avenue West, Seattle, WAA much needed new deli on Lower Queen Anne that served big, fat boars head sandwiches and paninis. The salads are good as well, though the soup varieties seem to never change.

properties.name: Quince
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1701 Octavia St, San Francisco,"This is no place for someone living paycheck to paycheck. In one of San Francisco\'s most fashionable residential neighborhoods, the small, smart eatery caters to folks with fat pocketbooks who plan ahead: tables are booked weeks in advance. Michael Tusk, who has cooked at the legendary Chez Panisse and Oliveto, oversees the kitchen. The menu, which changes daily and marries French, Italian, and American traditions, includes such inviting -- and delicious -- dishes as fresh pasta with scallops, duck breast and leg confit, wild nettle sformato (Italian-style custard), and more. The wine list is top-notch but pricey, and the service is both professional and friendly. Reservations essential." Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: R.T. Facts
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 22. S. Main St., Kent, CT"The boldest antiques are found at R. T. Facts (22 S. Main St.; 860/927-1700) where owners Natalie and Greg Randall stock muscular griffins, statuary, and lanterns, for the home and garden." Travel & Liesure April 2007

properties.name: Racha Noodles
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: Ramada Inn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 5 Ella Grasso Turnpike, Windsor Locks, CTAn above average Ramada next to Bradley Airport with a friendly bar, thick room service burgers and a smallish indoor, outdoor pool. The pickup from the airport took half and hour, though.

properties.name: Ravenous
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Italian bistro where the service was a little slow but the steak somthered in a zippy burgundy sauce with gorgonzola butter was superb. The appetizer, somewhat bland clams and mussels, came after the main course, though.

properties.name: Rawlins Plantation
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus St. Kitts"350 feet above sea level on the slopes of Liamuiga…will arrange hikes,,,,10 cottages" NYT 2/6/05

properties.name: Red Robin
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  1011 Alaskan Way, Seattle, WAYes it is a burger chain, but, in my opinion, better than most. You can\'t beat the view at this waterfront franchise, perfect with a kid in tow waiting for the water taxi.

properties.name: Residence Inn Anaheim Resort
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 11931 Harbor Boulevard, Garden Grove, CAIf it weren\'t for the unreliable shuttles to the park, this would be the ideal place to stay around Disneyland. Pleasant pool area with gas barbecues and spacious rooms.

properties.name: Restaurant August
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 301 Tchoupitoulas Street, New Orleans, LA

properties.name: Restaurant Guy Savoy
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3570 Las Vegas Blvd. S., Las Vegas, NV

properties.name: Restaurant Moosilauke
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 23 Maple St. Kent, CTThis romantic restaurant in a rustic 18th-century house serves market-driven dishes such as mulled cider-glazed Berkshire pork chops. Dinner for two from 6.

properties.name: Rick and Ann's Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2922 Domingo Ave. Berkeley, CAComfort food California style make this place popular breakfast through dinner.

properties.name: Ringside Steak House
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2165 West Burnside, Portland, ORSome would say classic, I would say tired. A Portland institution that does serve top notch steaks. However the whole presentation, from the rest of the menu, to the decor to the service feels dated to the point of discomfort

properties.name: Rioja
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1431 larimer street, denver coHigh end mediterranean fare. The meal starts with selecting bread from a huge basket. The smoked pork tenderloin was delicious.

properties.name: Ristorante Piccolo
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1068 31st st NR, Washington, DCI really wanted to like this place. Great ambience, on the balcony of an old Georgetown two story house. But the veal was bland and the antipasto seemed store-bought.

properties.name: Ristorante Walter Ridaelli
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 72 via Bandita, Bettolle, Italy"Ristorante Walter Redaelli As chef at the renowned Locanda dell\'Amorosa near Sinalunga, a half hour east of Siena, Walter Redaelli served an exceptional Mediterranean menu. Now he\'s opened his own intimate country inn and trattoria in nearby Bettolle, where his specialties include pici (handmade pasta ropes that resemble thick spaghetti) and porcini-flecked gnocchi topped with grated black truffles. Redaelli has also compiled a Tuscan-focused wine list with top Montepulciano producers, like Poliziano and Boscarelli. DETAILS 72 via Bandita, Bettolle; 011-39-0577-623-447. " Food and Wine October 2006

properties.name: Ritz Carlton Dining Room
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 600 Stockton Street, San Fransciso, CA"The stiffly formal Dining Room, with French windows, fine linens, and an encyclopedic wine list, serves only prix-fixe French seasonal dinners, priced by the number of courses. The Terrace, a cheerful, informal spot with a large garden patio for outdoor dining, serves breakfast and lunch daily, a Sunday jazz brunch, and dinner Sunday and Monday" Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: River Inn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 924 25th st nw, washington, dcTucked away on a quiet residential street lined with charming town houses, the River Inn will make you forget that you\'re moments away from busy K Street and the Kennedy Center

properties.name: Roti Restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 530 Queen Anne N., Seattle, WAAn above average Indian buffet that gets a bit repetative if you come back often enough. Buttery chicken tikki, a good variety of pakoras with tomato chutney and tasty, moist tandoori.

properties.name: Royal India Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Fairly standard Indian restaurant with a good lunch buffet.

properties.name: Russian River Campground
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusA sprawling campground above the Russina River. This is fish central and it gets crowded. But is has great access to fishing and hiking. I ended up liking this spot despite early trepidation that I went all the way to Alaska to bed down in the land of the goombahs.

properties.name: Rwanda National Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "In Butare, the National Museum—arguably the best in East Africa—provides an excellent background on the country\'s complicated history and culture (several exhibits are explained in French only)." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Ryoanji Temple
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"The former Imperial capital is filled with temples and gardens, but late-15th-century Ryoanji ("Temple of the Peaceful Dragon") stands out for its stark simplicity. Its walled-in courtyard contains nothing more than 15 large mossy rocks surrounded by a sea of raked gravel, the quintessential Zen garden." T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Sack's Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  328 G St, Anchorage, AK

properties.name: Saigon Grill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 93 University Place, New York,NY

properties.name: Saito's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 2122 Second Avenue, Seattle, WALonstanding downtown sushi spot won me over with a hearty sukiyaki soup with beef, mushrooms and rice noodles in a sweet broth.

properties.name: Salt River Bay
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  virgin islands"Views of the sea, mangroves, and the site of a tiny village where Columbus and his sailors fought the Carib Indians" NYT 10/31/04

properties.name: Saltaus
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1350 West Randolph Street, Chicago, IL"In a century-old former corned beef factory, Saltaus has elegant, minimalist lines, a garden patio and no identifying sign. The food comes with Mediterranean and Asian touches. Try the hummus, with both a sweet and tangy edge, and the four small bites of flavor in a global dim sum (appetizers from to 5). For the virtuous, the sautéed halibut is light in a ginger miso broth. But Chicago still loves its meat even if it’s not packed around here. So, try a rich tenderloin that sits beside roasted mushrooms and olive beef jus (entrees run 2 to 4)." NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: Salty's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1936 Harbor Ave. SW, Seattle

properties.name: Sambiya River Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "The Sambiya River Lodge does a luxurious take on thatched-hut living just 15 miles from Murchison Falls (256-41-233-596; afritour@africaonline.co.ug; doubles, 20, including meals). " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: San Francisco Museum of Modern Art
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  151 Third Street San Francisco, CA 94103"Mario Botta designed the striking SFMOMA facility, completed in early 1995, which consists of a sienna brick facade and a central tower of alternating bands of black and white stone. Inside, natural light from the tower floods the central atrium and some of the museum\'s galleries. A black-and-gray stone staircase leads from the atrium to four floors of galleries. Works by Henri Matisse, Pablo Picasso, Georgia O\'Keeffe, Frida Kahlo, Jackson Pollock, and Andy Warhol form the heart of the diverse permanent collection, which art enthusiasts claim isn\'t the world-class collection it should be." Fodor\'s Travel Wire

properties.name: Sanford
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1547 N. Jackson St., Milwaukie, WI

properties.name: Sausage Tree Camp
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Sausage Tree Camp has brought white tents and an upbeat atmosphere to this spectacular reserve (260-1-212597; sausagetreecamp.com; doubles, 80–,048, all-inclusive) " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Shanghai Tang
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "You are stepping back into the Shanghai of the 1930s when you enter this small but upscale two-level store with its gleaming wooden and tiled floors, raised cashier cubicles, ceiling fans, and helpful clerks wearing classical Chinese jackets. This is Chinese chic at its best, with neatly stacked rows of updated versions of traditional Chinese clothing, ranging from cheongsams and silk pajamas to padded jackets, caps, and shoes -- all in bright, contemporary colors and styles. If you\'re looking for a lime-green or shocking pink padded jacket, this is the place for you. " Frommers

properties.name: Shilla
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 600 Fifth Ave. E, Seattle,WAAnother standout food stall at the Uwajimaya Food Court. Spicy kim chee soup is the best. Cheap and gut warming.

properties.name: Shiwa Ngandu
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Built by an eccentric in the 1920s, Shiwa Ngandu is an English manor house in the remote North Zambian bush, complete with silver service, four-poster beds, horseback riding, and fishing (260-1-220747; shiwangandu.com; doubles, 00, including meals)" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Silene
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Silene Monte Amiata, southern Tuscany\'s highest peak, is covered with national parkland. "These woods are famous for their wild mushrooms and game," says chef Roberto Rossi, who opened his restaurant in the pretty hill town of Seggiano. "The mountain communities base their traditional dishes on these seasonal foods." Rossi\'s specialty is meat: His scottiglia (a Sunday farmers\' stew made with chicken, pork, beef and a hint of tomatoes) and his pigeon with Sienese tarragon and hand-cured salumi are sensational. He also uses his excellent artichoke-scented olive oil, Il Silene, to dress vegetables such as the spinachlike erbette. DETAILS Loc.Pescina, Seggiano; 011-39-0564-950-805. " Food and Wine October 2006

properties.name: Silver Star Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  723 silver sw, albuquerque, nmGood breakfasts and latte\'s

properties.name: Singapore Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1134 19th St SW, Washington, DCA variety of Asian dishes, from sushi to stir fries, in this three story popular lunch spot.

properties.name: Sir John Soane's Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Architect John Soane, designer of the Bank of England and the Dulwich Picture Gallery, rebuilt three adjacent town houses from 1792 to 1823 and filled them with his treasures—an Egyptian sarcophagus, Roman marbles, Hogarth\'s The Rake\'s Progress. Displayed chockablock, they now form part of a connoisseur\'s legacy in a museum that retains the character of a private house while its clever design accommodates a collector\'s zeal." T & L September 2006

properties.name: Sizzlin' Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  523 West Third Ave., Anchorage, AKReindeer sausage wraps at this popular breakfast spot

properties.name: Skamania
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus1131 Skamania Lodge Way; Stevenson, Washington (3 1/2 stars; Bunny Mason) Tight and quirky with spectacular scenry, this course has a few too many steep elevation changes and blind shots, but is an enjoyable round if you are hitting it straight.

properties.name: Skeleton Coast Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "This foggy, 300-mile coastline bordering a savage desert earned its scary sobriquet from the whale bones and shipwreck debris that littered its beaches; its forbidding conditions continue to deter all but a colony of hardy seals." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Sloane-Stanley Museum
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  31 Kent-Cornwall Road, Kent, CT"The nucleus of this museum is local artist, author and illustrator Eric Sloane’s (1905-85) extensive collection of Early American and pre-Industrial Era tools. Open May-Oct." T&L April 2007

properties.name: Soizic Bistro
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Attractive and unpretentious French/California restaurant. The belgian endive salad with pears, gorgonzola and spices walnuts was outstanding, as was the pecan tart with white pepper ice cream. Recommended.

properties.name: Sossusvlei Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Just outside Namib-Naukluft National Park, Sossusvlei Lodge has 45 cushy bungalows with uninterrupted views of the desert (264-63-693223; sossusvleilodge.com; doubles, 20, including meals). " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: South Luangwa National Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "South Luangwa National Park has a number of excellent lodges and camps and is the most accessible of the four parks in the wildlife-rich Luangwa River Valley. It\'s best known for its walking safaris—rare in Africa—in which visitors explore by foot or even trek from one camp to the next." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Spago
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 176 N. Canon Drive, Beverly Hills, CA"Look there\'s Julia Roberts! And over there, isn\'t that Tom Hanks? After 20 something years of catering to movie stars and the people who love them, after spawning an entire empire for owner Wolfgang Puck, this restaurant has no right to be as good as it is." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Spezie
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1736 L street NW, Washington DCAn upscale Italian place with rich, flavorful fare. The ravioli with a creamy pistachio sauce was just the right combination of sweet and zippy. The buffalo mozzerella with roasted red peppers was a great starter.

properties.name: Stanley
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"At the end of the line, in Stanley Market, you\'ll find an easy-to-navigate warren of shops, many offering what appear to be the same pashmina scarves, silk ties and paintings of Hong Kong\'s harbor. But a closer look will reveal great shopping: the stores on Old Stanley Street for childrens\' clothes, Tong\'s for table linens (55-57 Stanley Street; 852-2813-0337) and Sun & Moon for sportswear (18 A-B, Stanley Main Street; 852-2813-2723). Don\'t miss two of the nonshopping sights in Stanley: the Murray Building, a colonial treasure that was dismantled on the other side of the island and rebuilt here in 2000, and the Tin Hau temple, built in 1767 and dedicated to the deity who protects seafarers." NYT 4/6/07

properties.name: Star Ferry
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"This ferry has been a Hong Kong fixture for so long that many assumed it would remain an immutable feature of local life. They were wrong. Its famous downtown terminal was demolished in 2006, mainly to make way for a highway. The new terminal, across the street from Hong Kong’s tallest building, Two International Financial Center, is at the tip of a landfill that sticks out like a long peninsula toward Kowloon, shortening the ferry’s route. The trip across the harbor takes just five minutes now and is less entertaining. Much better are the round-the-harbor tours. The Star Ferry has outfitted one of its beautiful wood-decked vessels with armchairs instead of benches and added a small snack kiosk. The Shining Star sails once an hour around the harbor, stopping in Central and Wan Chai on the Hong Kong island side and in Tsim Sha Tsui on the Kowloon side; there are also stops in Hung Hom, an unprepossessing area of Kowloon, during daylight sailings." NYT 4/5/07

properties.name: Steelhead Diner
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 95 Pine St. , Seattle, WA

properties.name: Stonewall Kitchen Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  stonewall lane, york, me"Known for its outstanding preserves and sauces…menu leans toward comfort food standards like steak-frites and chicken potpie" Food and Wine May 2004

properties.name: Strawberry Hill
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus irish town, jamaica"12 cottage resort on its own Blue Mountain peak at 3,000 feet….offers guided trips of varying lengths…also has a full service spa." NYT 2/6/05

properties.name: Striped Bass
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1500 Walnut Street, Philadelphia, PA"Irresistable fish preparations. In addition to the signature striped bass wrapped in cabbage, there are also dishes like escolar with pecan-maple grits and miso marinated black cod." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Sunfish Fish and Chips
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus2800 Alki Avenue SW, seattle, waPerhaps Seattle\'s best Fish and Chips along the beach at Alki. The grilled halibut skewer offers a low fat alternative most fish and chips joints can\'t touch.

properties.name: Super 8 Motel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 501 New York Ave NE, Washington DCThe hotel clerk is in a cage. Need I say more.

properties.name: Sushi Tora
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus2014 10th St, Boulder, CO, 80302

properties.name: Swimming at Meadow Park Sports Center
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: Swimming at Second Beach Pool
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   One of the great outdoor pools. Spectacularly situated on the shores of English Bay within Stanley Park. The pool has three slides a lap section and a huge expanse of shallow water for kids. All for just a couple of bucks.

properties.name: Sylvia Beach Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus   267 Nw Cliff St, Newport, OR"It\'s known as a hotel for book lovers. And for lovers. And others just seeking a little eccentricity-by-the-sea. Each room at this hotel on the bluff at Nye Beach, a neighborhood of shingled beach shacks, is decorated in the spirit and style of a favorite author, from Colette to Dr. Seuss. 20 rooms from 8; www.sylviabeachhotel.com or 888/795-8422." Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: Taj Mahal
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Emperor Shah Jahan, in 1632, commissioned this most famous of all mausoleums for his favorite wife, Mumtaz. One of the greatest examples of Moghul architecture—a marriage of Hindu, Persian, and Islamic design—the Taj sits amid serene pools that reflect its unmistakable profile." T & L Sept 2006

properties.name: Tamarind Tree
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1036 S. Jackson St., Seattle, WAUnique and popular, this surprisngly upscale Vietnamese Restaurant is tucked away in a small shopping complex in the ID. The dishes are pungent and unapologetic. The atmosphere pleasant and as secretive as the hidden location.

properties.name: Taqueria Guaymas
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  4719 California SW, Seattle, WAAn old standby that has absolutely gone downhill of late. It has the frayed ambience of real Mexico, but the portions of late have grown skimpy, the service was never more than perfunctory and the carnitas are more fat that pork. Mas tipico?

properties.name: Tartaruga Maritima
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "The tiny, tucked-away Tartaruga Maritima tent camp is in the extreme south, close to the South African border. Getting there requires a 370-mile drive on good roads from Johannesburg: Camp staff will collect you at the border, where it\'s safe to leave your vehicle. Set on a gorgeous Indian Ocean beach, the eight comfortable, airy tents have en suite bathrooms and decks (27-11-728-4942" Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Teatro del Sale
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 111 via dei Macci, Florence"Teatro del Sale Chef Fabio Picchi\'s new spot in a 14th-century food cellar is one of Florence\'s most theatrical restaurants—especially at dinner, when musicians and other entertainers perform on stage. It\'s much more tranquil, and economical, at lunch: 9 (plus the annual membership fee) buys access to a large table of delicious Mediterranean-inspired dishes like spaghetti dotted with anchovies, or spicy fish stew with couscous. Teatro del Sale is right across the street from Picchi\'s other restaurants: the famed Cibrèo and Caffè Cibrèo (which is great for light suppers). DETAILS 111r via dei Macci, Florence; 011-39-055-200-1492." Food and Wine Oct 2006

properties.name: The Baxter
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 43 W. Main, Bozeman, MTLobby Restaurant in restored old hotel serves top-notch salads for lunch.

properties.name: The Bed and Breakfast Inn at La Jolla
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 7753 Draper Ave., La Jolla, CA"Strike up the band. Located a block and a half from the beach, this is the onetime home of composer John Philip Sousa. But it\'s not only the inn\'s pedigree that makes it special — it\'s the details: sherry and fresh flowers in each of its traditionally styled rooms. The lower-priced rooms are a bit small, but you can stretch out in the inn\'s gardens and deck if you need a little extra space. 15 rooms from 79; www.innlajolla.com or 800/582-2466." Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: The Dining Room at the Regent Beverly Wilshire
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 9500 Wilshire Boulevard, Beverly Hills, CA"In any season a meal in The Dining Room is a celebration. Parisian elegance-grand, silk-swagged windows and wall panels of 18th century garden scenes-but the mediterranean meets the Pacific Rim in the adventurous menu." Gourmet December 1995

properties.name: The Dining Room at the Ritz-Carlton Buckhead
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3434 Peachtree Road N.E., Atlanta, GA

properties.name: The Egg and I
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusA CO based breakfast chain that serves a creative selection of, you guessed it, egg dishes

properties.name: The Frankfurter
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  305 Harrison St., SeattleA hot dog stand with a good kids special. Nothing more. Nothing less.

properties.name: The French Laundry
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 6640 Washington St, Yountville, CA"Keller is a chef who can pair tapioca with oysters and caviar, deconstruct shad roe into a kind of porridge and nudge fennel into a smooth sorbet." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: The Green at Grant Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  352 East Monroe Street, Chicago, IL"slip away from the crowds to the unlikely and often overlooked Grant Park miniature golf course, the Green at Grant Park (352 East Monroe Street, 312-642-7888), which seems to be camouflaged in the sea of green around here. Adults can play 18 holes (par 42) f"or , and children for ." NYT 9/15/06

properties.name: The House
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1230 Grant Ave, San Francisco, CAVery popular, I know. But I found the food average at best, the fusion dishes unimaginative and tired and the benches among the most uncomfortable I\'ve found anwhere.

properties.name: The Inn at Little Washington
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: The Kitchen
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1039 Pearl St., Boulder, COPopular bistro on the Pearl Street Mall has a selection of salads, sandwiches and main dishes. The lamb burger was topped with a fruity chutney.

properties.name: The Lenox Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 61 Exeter St., Boston, MA"Ecotourism in the heart of a big city? That\'s no contradiction for the Lenox, a leader in such efforts since 1990, when it was the first North American hotel to institute a towel- and linen-reuse program. This August, the Lenox (with its three sister properties) became one of the first hotels to offset the carbon emissions of all its electricity usage. Unbeknownst to guests, the polyester upholstery is spun from recycled soda bottles, and fireplace logs are a cleaner-burning pressed variety. The hotel\'s Swan Fund for the Environment, established in 1992, has donated more than 80,000 to local and national organizations. Concern for humankind also ranks high: The Lenox has given 4 million for affordable housing in Boston and funds two college scholarships (617-536-5300; lenoxhotel.com; doubles, 08–48)." Conde Nast Sept 2006

properties.name: The Peak Tram
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus"Hong Kong’s most popular tourist attraction is this pair trams that rumble up and down the steep hillside from downtown to a gap in the hills. Starting at a terminal across Garden Road from the United States consulate, the trams trundle between the aging apartment buildings of the Mid Levels neighborhood and then ascend a precipitous slope at angles of up to 28 degrees, emerging from among the skyscrapers and trees to lovely views of the harbor. At the top is the Peak Tower, an eight-story complex of stores and restaurants that has just been remodeled and has some of the best views in the city." NYT 4/6/07

properties.name: The Pink Door
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1919 post alley, seattle, waA world class deck would be enough. But the food here is also consistently good, with the anitpasta plate a real must

properties.name: The Pink Pearl
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: The Spring Resort
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus165 Hot Spring Boulevard, Pagosa Springs, CO

properties.name: The Springs Resort
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus

properties.name: The Springs Resort
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusLocation

properties.name: The Wharf
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 94 West Wharf Road, Madison, CTMillion dollar view from the porch. Ten cent food from the kitchen.

properties.name: Tiamo Resorts
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus andros islandPrivate beach bungalows with king size beds and open air rock-floored showers…bonefishing, kayaking, sailing and snorkeling

properties.name: Times Square Suites
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus Two room suites in the heart of of the West End at an affordable price. No typical hotel amenities except for secure parking and maid service. Highly recommended

properties.name: Todai
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus A chain Japanese buffet in Pacific Place isn\'t cheap and the sushi is plain. But this is still an enjoyable eat...the salad bar may be the best selection; variety ranges from kimchi to seaweed salad to watercress vinaigrette. Kids love the chocolate waterfall with marshmallows piled for the dipping.

properties.name: Tolovana Inn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 3400 S. Hemlock, Cannon Beach, ORTolovana Inn (800) 333-8890

properties.name: Tongabezi Lodge
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "A favorite with South Africans and Europeans, Tongabezi Lodge, on the banks of the Zambezi, has five lovely cottages and four spacious houses. Activities include boat safaris, visits to Victoria Falls, and a trip to Livingstone Island, where you can swim in a pool on the lip of the falls near where Livingstone himself once stood (260-3-324450; tongabezi.com; doubles, 10–,060, all-inclusive). " Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: Town Hall
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 342 Howard St, San Francisco, CASouthern food meets California cuisine to good effect. Pleasant heated outdoor seating. The main course of seared tuna and poached egg atop frisee was outstanding. The caramel cake was dense and sugary.

properties.name: Trattoria Nostrani
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 304 Johnson St., Santa Fe, NM"It\'s the rare tourist town restaurant that can keep its menu fresh....Chef Nellie Maltezos hates to be bored, so maybe you\'ll miss her veal crostini...until you get to taste the duck porchetta with duck liver pate and wild boar ragu." Gourmet Oct 2006

properties.name: Treebones Resort
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 71895 Highway 1, Big Sur, CA"These gorgeous wood-floored yurts offer the kind of views that fetch major bucks elsewhere on this stretch of coast. Sure, there are only communal bathrooms and showers — but there are also barbecue dinners and complimentary morning waffles. And with a swimming pool and hiking trails that launch right into the heart of Big Sur, this is sleepover camp as it should have been. Space books quickly here, especially yurts 15 and 16, which are the most private. 16 yurts from 35; www.treebonesresort.com or 877/424-4787." Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: Troiani
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1001 Third Avenue, Seattle, WA

properties.name: Turtle Dove Cottages
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus virgin islandsThree colorful cottages

properties.name: Union
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1400 first avenue, seattle, waExpanses of white plate can dwarf these carefully prepared dishes, but the preparations are unique and the taste combinations superb.

properties.name: Urasawa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 218 N. Rodeo Drive, Beverly Hills, CA

properties.name: Vals Spa
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "In a remote valley in southeastern Switzerland, the contemporary architect Peter Zumthor has elevated the ancient thermal bath to the realm of the sublime. Contrasts between light and shade, especially in otherworldly grottoes of quartzite shrouding softly lit pools, inform the experience. Incomparable Alpine views from outdoor spaces serve as a reminder that nature is the preeminent architect" T & L Sept. 2006

properties.name: Vetri
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1312 Spruce St., Philadelphia, PA

properties.name: Victoria Falls
properties.description: Posted by EdbogusDescribed by the Kololo tribe living in the area in the 1800’s as ‘Mosi-oa-Tunya’ - ‘the Smoke that Thunders’ and in more modern terms as ‘the greatest known curtain of falling water’, Victoria Falls are a spectacular sight of awe-inspiring beauty and grandeur on the Zambezi River, bordering Zambia and Zimbabwe

properties.name: Villa Amor
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "The feel of sea air on your face and a view of early-morning fishermen setting their lines ease you into the day at the Villa Amor, on the windswept Nayarit coast. A collection of oceanfront cottages built into a steep hillside, the villa epitomizes warmth, authenticity, and artfulness. Thatched roofs, curvy adobe walls, and — in some villas — plunge pools perched right over the hill will make you wish you could pack up the mood of this place and take it home. 35 cottages from 5; www.villaamor.com or 619/822-2731." Sunset Sept. 2006

properties.name: Villa Bordoni
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus "Scotsman David Gardner, a partner in Florence\'s Beccofino and Baldovino, has a gift for creating successful restaurants. His latest project has taken him out of town. "I wanted to move to the heart of Chianti\'s countryside," he says, "and then I saw Villa Bordoni and fell in love." Gardner completely remodeled the blue 16th-century country-house hotel outside Greve, decorating the place with hand-stenciled motifs and Spanish textiles, and restoring the walled garden. Young Apulian chef Francesco Fineo uses the original wood-burning oven for dishes like succulent veal chops with San Marzano tomatoes; he also teaches the villa\'s cooking classes. There are big names in the cellars, including acclaimed Super-Tuscans like Rampolla\'s Sammarco (six vintages are on offer). DETAILS 31–32 via San Cresci, Mezzuola, Greve in Chianti; 011-39-055-884-0004." Food and Wine Oct 2006

properties.name: Washington Inn
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 495 10th Street, Oakland, CASomewhat threadbare boutique hotel in Old Oakland. The rooms are smallish with some rough spots. But the price is right and the location, for Oakland, is convenient. Friendly staff and a lobby bar with sports blaring.

properties.name: Waterberg Plateau Park
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  "Waterberg Plateau Park contains more rare fauna, but to see the shiest of all, visit the research and education facility of the nearby Cheetah Conservation Fund (CCF). Guardians of Namibia\'s 2,500 cheetahs—the world\'s greatest concentration of the highly endangered species—CCF staff let visitors watch them feed and exercise captive cats and cubs; call in advance for feeding times (264-67-306-225; cheetah.org; suggested donation, )." Conde Nast May 2006

properties.name: West Coast Outlaw Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1701 Hwy 93 S, Kalispell, MTA sprawling Kalispell institution, the place for a Rotary Club meeting circa 1970. Otherwise quite utilitarian. Wireless internet works just fine, but there\'s something old, not in a quaint sense, about this place.

properties.name: Wild Ginger
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1401 3rd Avenue, Seattle, WA, 98101Now that Wild Ginger is a businesspersons emporium by day and a swanky night club by night, it has lost much of its unique flavor. The pan-asian cuisine this restaurant pioneered is done better by others and Wild Ginger\'s preparations seem a little tired.

properties.name: Windsor castle
properties.description: Posted by Edboguswindsor castleStanding at the very heart of British identity, Windsor is the oldest and largest castle in Britain and, with 1000 rooms, the largest occupied castle in the world.

properties.name: Wolwedans

properties.name: Zed's
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus 1201 28th St., N.W. - Washington, DCAtmospheric in an old Georgetown building and usually bustling, the spongy bread is used to scoop up any number of moderately spicy combos of lamb, chicken and beef. Most dishes need a little more zip.

properties.name: Zuni Cafe
properties.description: Posted by Edbogus  1658 Market Street, San Francsico, CA"Owner-chef Judy Rodgers is a national star, and after one bite of her whole roast chicken and Tuscan bread salad for two, you\'ll be applauding, too. Dining is on two floors at Zuni: a rabbit warren of rooms on the second level includes a balcony overlooking the main dining room. At the long copper bar, trays of briny-fresh oysters on the half shell are dispensed along with cocktails and wine. The southern French-Italian menu changes daily (though the signature chicken never leaves) but may include house-cured anchovies with Parmigiano-Reggiano, a salad of persimmons with prosciutto and candied walnuts, and stuffed quail. Desserts are simple and satisfying and include crumbly crusted tarts and an addictive cream-laced coffee granita. Reservations essential." Fodor\'s Travel Wire
